fGjgXPkm2xl_3-dWiHqMpA.text: I ate at ghandi on paradise for the lunch buffet recently, the food was decent, cost was 10$ nothing amazing.

TMNcFhXXkRnn8dGegGlkAA.text: Average food. Good, traditional and ethnic atmosphere. Buffet items are often cold and limited. Service is rude, unless you are an ethnic Indian. They often take your food away while you are still eating and do not like to answer questions. I prefer Tamba restaurant myself, which I hear is managed by same individuals. However, they just started managing this place, so maybe there are good things to come...we shall see.

u1aSNL7Gu2XosYkudZPMuw.text: The food was superb. The service? Well, it was clear our party was a burden to the server. We weren't told that we'd be charged extra for things like rice and bread, even though the server kept bringing us more. I'm not sure how much each side of rice was, but it was really expensive and they didn't bring us a complimentary portion for our entrees. The portions were tiny. Think Happy Meal tiny. This wouldn't be a problem if the prices weren't so high. All in all, I won't be back, but I'll be looking for another restaurant that has good food, good portions, good prices, and good service. 2 stars just for the food.

qHpCJrEXT037aXjILr2CBw.text: I've never had such a bad experience with Indian food.  The food was serve on a metal tray like the one in prisons, its terrible and it is rediculousy expensive for the qaulity and portion.  Unbelievable!!!  Spend your money elsewhere.

XTAreYRFc4kzN-1V5lNltQ.text: This place isn't as good as Orgin India (just down the street) or  India Palace (also just down the street), but you can do a lot worse.  We have dined here a few times (with our 1-year-old), and we had a great time.  The food is good--not stellar--but good.  It has what I consider to be a run-of-the-mill Americanized Northern Indian menu.  Typical selection of Indian beers.  Staff was very friendly.  Food was great quality.  Everything we have ordered has been good.

cBGrn9zx0TKob6HKQ09IIw.text: Lunch Buffet was very crowded on the weekend--long line, but water/drink service was still good.  A wide variety of food--nan was actually out in the buffet line which was nice to see done.  Only thing was the plastic utensils bothered me.  I could live with the plastic water cups but plastic forks and spoons seem like picnic items and eating tandori chicken with them proves difficult.  I was glad to see a well stocked buffet even with such a crowd!  Good food- but not the best to bring me back often-mango lassi was okay too.

6HrF-nYg9VtNjwJiWizBrQ.text: I've been told this is some of the best Indian food in town.  Oh boy am I in trouble.  I miss good Indian food.

Ql1HAsi2F1tN9zkyNYmTng.text: i can't believe this place had a banner outside calling it the "best ethnic restaurant of las vegas."  i don't remember what year or what company judged this place, obviously the judges might have ate at this establishment years ago, or the judges had been starving...for days, so that anything tastes delicious.  prior to eating here, my party was suggested by other frequent patrons that this place was "hella good!" i was very disappointed because as i walked in I noticed the buffet line.  we were told that a la carte items were not offered, so that means the buffet food has been sitting out or possibly left overs from yesterday!  the tandoori chicken was so dry and unflavorful.  the lamb was full of flavor from all the spices but was just too tough.  a lot of the vegatable dishes had more cauliflower than expected (filler???)....so a lot of farting.  ooh, and that shredded carrot dessert...yech.  the only yummy thing was the tangy mango lassi.  im not sure if one of the dishes i had was palak paneer.  if it was, it didnt taste like what ive had before.    the decor of this place was so dated.  it was white walled with a high ceiling with a huge rug above you.  it was also very chilly inside.  the buffet line took away the appeal and decor of the place.  im assuming they went buffet style b/c of the lack of business.  it is a hard find with morton's and buca di beppo right smack in front of you.   i really do love indian food can somebody please help out here...is there a fantastic indian restaurant in las vegas?

54olar4cuKdo-7QTOvmO5Q.text: Good atmosphere, once you get inside. Knowledgeable/helpful staff. Lamb was tough, but vegetarian picks were good.

6b0uW9eLL1bJaK9Yikf6Yw.text: I've been to Gandhi many time and I've never been disappointed with them either on service or the food. My favorite is during the lunch buffet, the price is very reasonable and very tasty(even better with 10% off coupon which you can find it on magazine all the time), my Indian neighbor also told me not only they think the food are great, the restaurant never charge their 5 and 4 year old kids, my india friends from CA also loves the food there. The dinner was a bit more expensive, but well worth it, they have combination dishes that you can get for $16, which include appetizers, 2 course entree, dessert and drinks, I felt just right after I finish it, and the services were good. Although Origin India has better review, but I've been there just twice and hate their service already(please refer to the one about coupon), trust me, I would rather go to a friendly restaurant where I feel welcome than going to a restaurant with great food but got insulted by the waiters. here's my review to Origin India, if you want to have great food but in a mood of being insulted, here's the best place to go yelp.com/biz/origin-indi...

BIdHrR5EwQ1IvSRxLfRdoA.text: I love this place!! So good! Great staff and some of the best around. Looks like a hole in the wall but delicious and love the atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Gandhi India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum scrum.

WeGfrqK7FLwq3CQ4LnGZuA.text: I am here from . Baltimore . Indian food like this place . Excellent service with mind blowing food . Highly recommended .. Love it ..

photos.caption: Photo of Gandhi India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1QiTHQt_75aWtn5M5WwEcQ.text: Every time I visit Vegas, i never miss Gandhi's lunch buffet.I am doing this from years now. I even had dinner here sometimes and it is not bad either. I like this place but don't expect anything outstanding. It is an average restaurant with good and tasty Indian food.  I recommend this place to everyone who are in search of a good meal after a exhausting day of fun in Vegas.

cSslCcHl8M82n0W9j_KC2Q.text: Love this place, the food is very delicious! The waiters were constantly making sure we had everything we needed. Cool decorations, definitely a spot we'll come back to.

P6LJFzTJuThxaV8hDjcCpg.text: The food was AMAZING. We went to a different Indian restaurant down the street that was not good. We decided to try Ghandi as our cravings weren't satisfied w our last meal and couldn't have been happier. Finally found our go to Indian spot in Vegas!

L1MxzE1JRIyLxwQc4HSxqA.text: Best Indian buffet in Las Vegas  I am pure non vegetarian & my wife is vegetarian. And we visit Vegas several times every year since last 17 years. I have dined at many desi restaurants here. This is my second review of Gandhi. Last time I gave a 3 star not because their food was not good but because of other reasons. but now they deserve better rating. The lamb curry is fantastic (my all time favorite) & so was the chicken tikka masala.  My wife loves the malai kofta & so did I. We love their rice & dal fry too. And no, they don't use plastic ware or paper cups for buffet anymore. I have dined in many Indian restaurants all throughout the US & I think Gandhi is one of my favorite North Indian restaurant. Their Indian buffet definitely ranks in top 3 in the US. Good job team!!

LauuzBISN54X6p9mz-P_ZA.text: Glad my friend recommended this gem to me. I was craving Indian food during my trip to Vegas, and decided to stop in for dinner with a couple friends.  I was politely greeted at the entrance by the staff, and was asked which kind of seating I prefer. Obviously I picked the booth. The booths were extremely comfortable and spacious. The lighting of the restaurant made it extremely relaxing.  I proceeded to the drinks menu, which had a good variety of spirits & most importantly for me...a few solid craft beers (rare for an Indian restaurant). We ordered the chicken tikka as an appetizer, and for dinner the daal, butter chicken, and methi chicken. We got a few orders of butter naan to go with the entrees. All of the food was delicious, and was definitely authentic indian (I'm indian so I would know). Overall I'm extremely satisfied with this place. I definitely recommend going here if you want quality authentic Indian food in a setting of friendly staff, nice ambience, and a real India feel.

7LXtGXjYYFOR_gS75bdqww.text: Thank you Gandhi's Indian Cuisine. Our server Crystal made my wife and I Valentines Day dinner very special. Our table was presented with a lit candle and little heart confetti decorations. Her customer service, attention to detail and smile made our evening. The food was amazing. We are definitely telling all our friends to visit this place. And ask for Crystal, of course!

V3KgzmPOhSfWEzGPnPVkKw.text: I may return, I may not. It was a rainy day, and they were serving buffet. They told me flat out I couldn't order off the menu and had to eat the buffet. I really didn't get that. They were empty and you'd think that they would want to accomodate any business they can get.   So, hopefully, some day I'll get a chance to order off the menu and write a real review. In short, the service bit the big one and they weren't very helpful.  Maybe next time...

I9KNiIKiNv6cYEAH29FJgw.text: We walked inside the restaurant very excited to eat at this famous restaurant for dinner and when we entered inside this seemingly authentic Indian restaurant we found it almost empty with none of the hotel staff anywhere in sight and just a couple of diners sitting in one table. we decided to wait for a couple of minutes to see if anyone from the staff would appear. But no one showed up. After waiting for 5 minutes we decided to leave. It was extremely disappointing that a restaurant with such good reputation would give us such a terrible experience!!!

lFf-2T1emUH1zC3ztn_YVA.text: Perfect end to the day! Just what you need after a tiring trip to Grand Canyon.. when burgers/ pizzas just wont cut it anymore.. go for the buffet, you wont regret it!

i-WRL1kINKq_Qeg-Q5w84g.text: Please AVOID this place !! If given an option I will give 0 stars  When we walked in, we were told they dont serve ala carte items and only buffet option. But what they didnt tell us was, they wont refill the buffet items. Whatever items we asked, they said its over and not be refilled. The tandoori chicken was too unflavourful and tasted. None of the Paneer dishes had paneer. Idli was too hard and made days ago. They just heated the frozen idlis and served them. The only thing they refilled was plain rice and Naan. Desserts were also bad.  The service is ok but not great. But definitely not worth the price you pay for the buffet.

bXTZFuEfKeP24LR036gsMw.text: Lunch Buffet is at the most average. Especially for vegetarians. When you don't have a vegetable pulav or biryani there isn't really much you can do to the buffet with not so great curries. There are no people to take out the remaining plates. This kind of takes the appetite away when the remaining plates are still on the table. The seating is also not so great with tables very close to each other. I was a regular here before but deeply disappointed with my recent visit. I would never go here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Gandhi India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plates not being taken away.

KEJyRDPL2neWeBe8OTkoAA.text: Worth finding! Great food, nice atmosphere and well looked after. Highly recommended. Tarka Dall was excellent and they serve red Kingfisher. Will be back very soon.

u2i-VpqL8_TzHAKugvp7vw.text: For years every time I travel to Las Vegas, I must eat at Gandhi. It is a good stop for vegetarians like me.  Good naan, daal and mutter pulao.

pJTr8yfVC-6wXEHF0XSEcg.text: Really great location. The tikka masala was creamy and hot and my husbands Bhuna was very flavorful.  The onion bhaji was a bit over cooked.   Overall the service was good and we were well looked after.  The prices were much more reasonable than Mint just down the street.

5_NDhFfPB8wsB4xkaRFrLw.text: Overall, I thought this place was fine. I liked the decor, and the high ceilings. I liked the food. The bathroom was clean and nice.  I don't know, man..... I just don't really know what else to say. This place was just average I guess. I was there for the lunch buffet and to repeat Misti Y., it did seem like for what they offered combined with freshness level, it was a tad pricey. I did think the food tasted really good, and I liked the vegetarian dishes and both dessert options. They had a carrot/raisin pudding and a sweet rice noodle/coconut pudding. Mixed together, it was so friggin' GOOD!   Now here's the major bummer. One of my favorite things is Indian "Nan" bread. I was NOT feein' this place's nan (at least, not on the buffet). It's supposed to be somewhat fluffy and soft. This place's nan seemed like it had sat out too long or something, because it was flat and pretty hard in places. It was disappointing, because it is meant to be ripped up and used to scoop up the yummy rice and curry mix with your hands. I couldn't even rip off a piece anywhere without getting a hard, unbend-able hunk of bread.  I was recommended to try the Kingfisher beer, which apparently is a popular beer consumed in India. It's a light beer, but has a bitter, hoppy kick to it.. Unfortunately, I had to flag down a waiter just to order it.  They sat us down, and just left. My mom wanted to go up and get a plate immediately, but I told her to wait a few minutes because at a buffet, they are supposed to come over and ask what you want to drink. No one ever came. We just sat there staring at each other for five minutes while waiting for someone to stop by the table, to no avail. Kinda odd.  Maybe I will come back for dinner, but I feel like I could find an Indian restaurant just as good (if not better) for less money. For two lunch buffets and a beer, the bill was like $34! Holy S*IT!   One positive: If you go on their website, you can print out a 15% coupon! You will need it with those prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Gandhi India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kingfisher Beer, and that hard, flat nan I was talking about.

ZS8QHd1TnkmAjNRkI3-UAQ.text: One of worst Indian restaurants. Served food which might have been in the freezer for a while. We went to lunch buffet sweet rice and chicken curry are out of freezer for sure. They charged $13 per person for that.   PLEASE DO NOT GO....

AD74BtDbZqMedkv8YPdliw.text: Fantastic food, super fresh and tasty. great atmosphere and the owners are amazing! Will be coming here again when we are in Vegas again. Thank you for fantastic food!!

46htYYRyPrYYNy-_xoCPzw.text: If for nothing else, stop in here and get a hot tea... No joke. They are $3.50 and spiced like no tea in Las Vegas. Cardamom and stuff, who cares what's in it, just get some!  The food was great too, a bit pricey but hey :)

hTirniqg7Qb0Sa85CtkLmA.text: What I remember most about Gandhi: the surprising interior and the tad expensive price tag on the lunch buffet (and my charming lunch companion). The buffet was large with plenty of vegetarian selections, and the food was good. I thought the flavors were tempting; they led me back for a second plate, but the vegetables were a tad overcooked, and hence, some things did not appear to be the freshest. Overall, I enjoyed my lunch, but when I find myself thinking about the interior and cost, I know that the food was not mind-blowingly delicious. At $12 the price is not the best value for Indian buffet, which is always a consideration for me. (The star rating is largely a reflection of the price.) Plus, since visiting Gandhi, I have revisited my go-to Indian buffet to confirm my taste buds preference.  The interior is quite impressive, a remodel since the days of the overhead carpet, and a stark contrast to the exterior surroundings. There are private rooms in the back, and I could see hosting a small private dinner here, as the restaurant feels spacious and nice.   However, this may be the last time I stray from my tried and True all time fave Indian buffet in Vegas, as I think my taste buds might run away if I try to take them anywhere else!

QPAaPiJP5HLobPOOg0DRsw.text: Don't be deceived by the outside.  This restaurant is located at the end of a strip mall.  There's a simple neon sign outside and when you walk in it's a bit frightening for a moment.  Then you turn the corner and see a beautiful restaurant-- not what you'd expect.  The ceilings are high, the tables have high backs so you have a little more privacy, there are rooms that have curtains that can be drawn, and it's dimly lit.  The food is very good and the prices are reasonable and can't compare to anything on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Gandhi India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Palak Paneer and Chicken Vindaloo

M62DlthEhIojLcSOgGGgQQ.text: Awesome customer service. We visit this place every time we are in vegas. But on Dec 24th they only had dinner buffet and when we told the manager (Laddi) we were leaving cause we couldn't order our favorite dish (malai paneer) he had the kitchen make it for us!! We felt so special and taken care of!! U guys gotta try this place! U wont be disappointed!!!

hkyRKimV2fQMDG8knhqaCQ.text: Very very poor service...waited for 30 minutes to be seated and finally got a smelly dirty table with no water no utensils .. Do not suggest this at all..food comes too late..others in d area are far better

AcKhyacABn577B-COFDr8A.text: best food close to strip  Not sure why there are only 3 stars for this place. they deserve 5 stars. I have had food at Tamba and other places, but this was the best period

RHlAVQo7m-209AHt_jsReg.text: The food tastes horrible, rice was not cooked properly. Also the food was not fresh. Please do not even try this place.

I6WJ1C0zCy4Yyvi04dnnJA.text: Great place off the strip for delicious Indian food. The service was wonderful. My only complaint is the price. Very expensive considering everything is a la carte. They have a lunch special for $13 and I would return for that. Overall, if your looking for really good food with excellent service, this is your spot.

DRe6SkdqGhTB5Z9j7Ev8qw.text: Had this place last night and it was very good.  Ordered the tandoori mixed grill, chicken tikka masala, & paneer kadhai and all three dishes were hot and flavorful.  The service was a bit slow and since there were only few other tables being used thought it would've been better. Maybe they were a little short on staff since it was a Tuesday night.  Would've given 5 stars if the service more on the spot.

KeuMphF12lykmx_BGQM2-g.text: Phenomenal North IndianFood, the best the city can offer. Not only does it fill your appetite but also warms your heart. Service is great and the team there pay close attention to customers. Don't miss out on this!!!

JBkqFQR_AFuVaJashYIq6Q.text: I went to Gandhi's  while in Vegas with a friend of mine from high school back in July. If you don't know where this place is, chances are you probably won't find it as it is hidden within a strip mall and you would think it was closed down if you didn't know any better.  We were seated immediately as it appeared that my friend knew everyone in the place. Everyone made sure to come over and say hello and to constantly check on us all evening. I actually felt like a celebrity with all the attention we were getting. Anyway enough about that, onto the food.  We ordered the Paneer Pakora which was homemade deep fried cottage cheese, Gosht Vindaloo, and the Chicken Makhanwala along with tons of Nan. I was in Indian food heaven. The lamb was cooked to perfection and the Chicken had a nice blend of spices and the sauce was divine! I am sitting here licking my lips still remembering just how good it was.   This place is a nice little hidden gem that you should really try if you are ever in Vegas. You do realize that it means you will have to explore outside of the strip so venture if you dare :)

2bF0a9LP5Cfd1Qby_IzLTQ.text: I've been coming here for 16 years and the food and service are first class.  I am always greeted with a smile and friendly service.  If you want the best Indian cuisine in Las Vegas and the West Coast, then look no further.  Visit Gandhi's and you'll go no where else.

Yr4HgyTQ5aShjU0Up4Hv-w.text: Even though it doesn't look it from the outside, this place is actually very good in terms of food and ambience. They handle spices well. Chicken Bhuna and chicken Korma were great. For a place with fleeting traffic like Vegas, this place does justice to Indian cuisine.

vO7EV_W866vMuqxw-8B-PQ.text: The lamb stew was exceptional and the stuffed Nan bread was amazing. The house red wine was a great pair with the tandoori chicken. Had a great meal in a comfortable and cozy setting. Will definitely come back with friends and family.

3HjlXHvvRNgUAZ6N8SGwtg.text: Went for the buffet. The price was$20 per person which was high, and the buffer did not really match up the standards of a $20 buffet!  Food quality was good and staff was fine, but just felt overpriced given what they had on offer

C8RCtYaf4vkR0nvepybDdw.text: They illegaly isolated us from the main dining room because of my service dog. They put us in a large empty banquet room that had the AC and music blasting at uncomfortable levels, both of which are triggers to my medical condition.   When we asked why we were isolated from the other customers we were told it was an order from the boss. When I informed them that this was illegal as per ADA and state law they eventually moved us to the main dining room with the other customers, but were not apologetic about it.   The prices were pretty high too. I would not go back here.

pykydqG4-gxd4nbK5_brLg.text: We ordered 2 veg entrees yday for Togo (malai kofta and dal makhani) and mistakenly they gave us Matar paneer instead of malai kofta. When we called the restaurant,  and explained the front desk of their mistake , lady at d front desk put us on never ending hold and did not even apologize.  Guys , at least have some courtesy to apologize...Very Bad of Such a nice Name Restaurant...and we had to throw Matar Paneer out since it was not of the taste and pathetic to eat. MONEY WASTED !!!

7pWNk0b4DXypHUEpFY2PWg.text: My trip to Vegas is not complete without the fountains at the Bellagio, the lions at MGM and a few other places that I can't mention here. :-) But last but not the least is Gandhi India Cuisine's exquisite lunch buffet. I've been to Vegas (for various reasons :-)) 5-6 times and had lunch at this restaurant. Don't get me wrong, I am sure there are people who prefer the wide spread buffets at the casinos, but this one is no less.   The food is well cooked and the arrangement is nice. The price is, if I still remember, $10...all you can eat. Isn't that sweet? Its about a mile or so from the strip in a strip mall.   Enjoy!!!

Yv-2t9wv7Mbys5Rp6540OQ.text: I have to take back my four stars review about this fine Indian cuisine, that make me every time happier. we recently went to the buffet on the labor day weekend and, it was amazing experience. The food selection was excellent and we had few items out of the regular menu. still love the service, also the place.

9VoVjeua-3PJcKWeY_pzkA.text: I like Gandhis, always have. Sure, the parking is sketchy, and I wouldn't live in the adjoining neighborhood if they paid me, and there's at least 1 guy that lives (or @ least weekends) by the dumpsters, but this restaurant is very very good with an awesome buffet, beautiful decor and quality service... and that's all I can ask of them to be.

1HJSJDuRLi6n1C_-NFB64A.text: The scenery is pretty nice here. I would say Ghandhi has more selection on food. It was just a little disappointing since they didn't have that popular chicken dish I like. Service was fine.

iDLWC7-6Fez_Pa4KcpXk4g.text: What a hospitality, Awesome Food excellent Price affordable  Staff awesome I highly recommend to everyone to try food at Gandhi Indian Cuisine.

LdI9BV5jH8FDX5akvfukaA.text: This is the best India buffet I've been to. I come every time I hit Vegas. They simply have the best spread with the best flavors and freshest. I highly recommend this place if you love Indian food. Believe me, we are consumers of Indian buffets and this place rocks.

W2RN6vBvpsixRj0en7T4lw.text: I would never suggest this restaurant to anyone. We ordered chicken biryani, butter chicken and garlic nan and asked all of it to be spicy. Biryani is tasteless and it has raisins in it which made the taste worse. Chicken doesn't feel good at all. Big NO.

I'm so pleased and so glad this is my first experience with Indian food!

GJCT_EZfTjt9ysLZD76t6w.text: Food was delicious. Recommend highly.... loved the customer interaction and service.... new management has done a great job in a creating a welcoming environment!!!

galisgjAyftFPWxDFN30IA.text: After sampling a few of Gandhi's goods at a local casino banquet, my wife and I went to the restaurant the following weekend for dinner.The owner, Ladi, greeted us and made several recommendations, including the amazing butter chicken, and a sizzling sampler platter with spicy dipping sauce. We're definitely coming back; I don't think I could ever get enough of that butter chicken.

_qUNr2tvg4T9OrNOPSdLUA.text: This is my favorite Indian Restaurant by far in not only Vegas but out of a lot of places I've traveled world wide. Friendly staff, such good food. I've never had a bad meal from this place. So, so good!

We were just trying to enjoy our meal with each other, we hadn't seen each other for a while and we wanted to catch up. But Sammie wouldn't leave us alone and it seemed like he was flirting with us. It was very uncomfortable. The food was reall good though, wish we could've enjoyed it.

HsR8dFwKzN54YDOohR_oTw.text: Food was delicious! Crystal (and only crystal) was a great server! We ordered a huge selection and enjoyed almost everything, a few dishes could have been a little more spicy but the flavors were still great. Thanks for making my first Indian meal a delicious one.

PV29u5rvaD7ZYBHdkS1IVQ.text: I had the south India combo! My advice is to share it ! It's a huge plate. Food was great and very authentic. Service was a bit slow but it didn't affect my food experience.

Ih_k9BT6cyKdPe6IH2OpmQ.text: satpal was super speedy, and very kind. Good chicken tikka masala. Liked their Bollywood music choice.

syAA9dmRnPLInm62RBEuzQ.text: Food was ok nothing great as such to mention. Naan served on the table needs a mention as it was thin, crispy and not soggy. Good ambience, have parking place off the strip. Good if you are driving in Vegas.

zmHAgJdXDIEZ-EQI4P6pqg.text: We ordered take out from Gandi's because it was the closest to our hotel during our stay, and we ordered from the yelp app as well. First- rice is not included with your order. I didn't realize this when ordering, but it would have been nice to know beforehand! We picked up our order, went back to the hotel, and then had to go all the way back to pick up rice so we could eat. What kind of Indian place doesn't give you rice with your entrees? I have never, ever, been to one. The food was only okay. It was decent, and we ate it, but a disappointment overall. I would not come back.

ZQIqopyvrbTM40p5d_HQ9A.text: Have eaten Indian food in restaurants all over the world. Love tandoori foods. Recently enjoyed dinner - the tandoori chicken was the best I have eaten. The service was excellent. Highly recommend the restaurant.

aHTpWvaesvs1yifEJpwVIg.text: Wow! Driving down flamingo and saw a couple of Indian food joints. Ghandi had an authentic feel.  After going inside and seeing a buffet style set up, I was a little thrown off. After asking the lady, she explained you can either do the buffet or order off the menu.   I decided to stay because there were so many people there.......the food was so good. So good that I went back for dinner the same night. For dinner I ordered off the menu (there is no buffet at night anyways.) and I cannot believe the results.   The food off the menu was even better than the buffet (which was already some of the best Indian food I've had.) I will be eating here every chance I get every time i'm in vegas.  Favs: Chicken Masala, Lentil Soup, Basmati Rice, Garlic Naan, the dessert @ Buffet  ;-) (make sure to combine them!)

vk722UEh3UFsXUwlbVnCPQ.text: I absolutely LOVE Ghandi! I have been going to this restaurant for the last 7 years for their lunch buffet. Every visit is always better than the last and the food tastes amazing.  I even met the owner today and he was a very nice and humble man. All in all, I love it.

CuEE2S4O3Vqn_uCSbvRr5A.text: Food tastes great, even better customer service and great atmosphere. They also have buffet and its great value for the price.

mKwfJzIWhHX-_fZD9Eqphw.text: Typing while I am eating here. My service has been very good. Attentive , friendly, and polite staff is very welcoming upon arrival. The mint chutney is very good and a little spicy but I love hot food. My naan is over cooked and a little dry. The chicken vindaloo is exquisite . One of the better versions I have had. If you ask for hot, it is HOT. Be careful what level of spice you ask for. It is a really great place to eat. I give it 3.5 stars because of the naan.

96xi0bJes5dHfiFCFKxXJQ.text: Lunch buffet is perfect!   I am all about Indian Buffets. The price here is good too.   Went here for lunch with co-workers and had a great time. Plenty to choose from. The potatoes that have spinach in it is amazing. The naan is nothing to write home about, and some other just okay dishes . For sure try the butter chicken.   Best of all it's not too heavy!

R54s3f9vmPChauPbMq10pA.text: Came here twice in last 4 years. Made good Jain food for my parents and in laws when were in vegas on holiday.

lCPxnemWQ4FmJQj-lIMm8A.text: Delicious indian food you can find near the strip. Me and my husband simply love the buffet. I like having South Indian breakfast items with chicken curry .. So I took a serving of hot hot made upma with butter chicken curry  WOWW is the word !!!  I was so so so happy with the food that ..I badly wanted to leave a great feedback on yelp.. Hence created my yelp account. Isn't it crazy.. Food @ Gandhi definitely has that impact.

kbO5yS11Rp5wShA3zOI1eg.text: Looking for good Indian restaurant in Las Vegas for years, we finally found "THE ONE".  Everything about "Gandhi" is good (maybe location is a little farther than I would like)..  Decor: rich dark colors, very spacious rooms. Food: EXCELLENT! Papadom (compliments of the chef). Light crispy, not overly spicy. For starters we ordered Paneer Pakora. Very good seasoned excellent appetizer. Mulligantawny soup. Be prepared to unusual preparation, not what  you would expect, but very good.  Entries: Chicken Tikka Masala OMG!! Best Tikka Masala I ever had Fish Korma. This dish is not on a menu, but I asked if it would be possible to prepare it for us. That's another big STAR to Gandhi restaurant. Every our request was  accommodated. They try to make your dinner a real "experience". Which gives a great feeling of being taken care of.    Back to entries Eggplant Bharta. We asked to make it mild. Well.. you can not really make this dish mild it is meant to be spicy..But hey managed. Funny.. mild on a beginning it gives you a "kick"  a couple of sends later. We actually asked to make another one like it, so we can take it home! Naan. Excellent. Another item we ordered more for take out, we enjoyed later.  Prices: Surprisingly inexpensive. The portions are quite big. We ordered Mango Lassie, which was twice the size of any lassie we had before, price however was $3.50?  I almost was ready to say to our waiter that this is to cheap, and they should raise the price (but, of course I  did not say anything)  Overall great restaurant. If you get a chance stop here and you won't regret it.

gPzvbIMsUrLQDHWy3xaO3Q.text: Crystal was very helpful and accommodating. We loved the entire experience. It was a little odd that the entertainment was Indian MTV, but the staff food and facility were all great! Definitely recommend this place to those adventurous enough to try food they aren't as familiar with.

dASwV9SfGyQqwtlPYBUdEg.text: After a week of all you can eat in Vegas, what do you do next? Have AYCE Indian food of course. Back in college, my buddies and I would always swing by Gandhi India Cuisine at the end of each visit to Vegas. Nothing cures a hang over like nice buttery, saucy, and oiling Indian food :). It really isn't that disgusting when eating it.   Brian from Family Guy describes Indian food as...(Brian is so hungry he eats Stewie's diaper.) "Hey, at least its better than Indian food." That's exactly how I feel. Indian food quality is always hit or miss. If you cannot stomach "ethnic" foods, I don't recommend trying Indian food, but if you have a taste for adventure and have a strong stomach then try it. I love garlic Naan and curry chicken. There are a lot of other items and sauces that I'm not sure what they are, but they taste delicious. Be warned you will have a food coma after your Gandhi experience.   The restaurant is family owned and servers make you feel at home. I went a few times with Indian friends to help explain what everything is to me. This place is hard to find. It is near Terrible casino and behind a Morton's Steakhouse restaurant I think...near a massage parlor just off the strip. I think the way I first discovered this place was through a coupon in a Las Vegas magazine. My friends were semi-serious about going. It was a very hot day and our car broke down right in the same plaza. Call it fate or luck. I don't believe in luck. In Vegas, its ALL SKILL.

xyaKgoGTX5SSQw5ukCrmzA.text: Delicious food! The service was alright, not bad. But the quality of the food was worth a couple mix ups with our orders. Overall, I'd eat here every time I come to Vegas.

HRlOy-GMsl09eMwoWMtFqA.text: I'm not a person that usually writes reviews, but I have to say I'm very impressed by this restaurant and again being Indian I'm not very easy to be impressed with Indian food at the restaurant . The food was very tasty, the host, the waiter were all very patient and very courteous.  I could say that the nan could be a little better, but in their defense I was the last person before closing so not sure if that was the reason for then being a little cold, but anyhow you should definitely try this restaurant.

nFVVy6w91x3uP70R8NsOKw.text: One of my favorite places for Indian food. Their lunch buffet selection is good and all of their food is delicious! Staff is very friendly as well.

atilz2CRFcwc5i-GVBjLFw.text: Fantastic food and what a pleasure to be served by Christal!! Being in good business for over a decade I will highly recommend this place. Owner actually came down to introduce himself and asked if we were doing well. Tells be a lot about a joint when the owner cares. Authentic food!!

XlR0v08HE4Fd9USdjq-JgA.text: Decent ambience and courteous service topped the quality food out here. I came here ravaged with hunger and had a bhindi masala and two aloo parathas all to myself. The dishes were well made, and the aloo parathas lived up to the description. Will definitely visit again.

4-CUOdRbHV0jkzG_krcwpQ.text: Hosted my Daughters BabyShower here and it was a success. Was able to go one day in advance and decorate a good size room and the staff was very helpful. The next day, which was the BabyShower,  we arrived early and again the staff was very helpful and The buffet was amazing.  The Guests keep raving how good the food was.  The manager Crystal was outstanding, took care of us personally and making sure all of our needs were met! Amazing service by her!

Pi6UBPfrbq9ssnbSBQpVNg.text: A great place to host a party. The staff was helpful and the manager crystal was fantastic and the food was great like always! definitely recommend coming here

ozuQTM2FzachWP_eSDe_uw.text: Awesome vegetarian food especially Malai paneer and Dal tadka. Crystal Harris, our waitress was awesome for suggesting the food and drinks!! Will surely visit again!!

XNsZkeNTzaM_MJQv3TLCMw.text: Worst Indian Food, I've eaten lot of buffets, I will rank this last.  I only liked the navaratan curry and naan, everything else is horrible

dx_OB-CapOI75yO7lnXBFg.text: Worst place to eat for any South Indian. Very expensive buffet($15) for all tasteless food. No salt (or) spices in chicken dishes, but 1&1 only item we liked is chicken tandoori. Don't walk in and expect biriyani r any south indian style food. Bad ambiance and time in filling buffet items. Strongly recommend to stay away from this place if you like to have tasty & and good South Indian buffet.

F9chTYOu3dj7UN3WBiq45g.text: [Review is for the lunch buffet]  Not the best buffet in Vegas and not the cheapest (running about $12.95), but you can expect some good spice from the buffet options.  What sets Gandhi India Cuisine's buffet aside from other Indian buffets in Vegas is the surprising spice.  The general tendency in an Indian buffet is to keep it bland.  The buffet has to make a lot of different palates happy and the general tendency is to keep it bland to make the most folks happy.  But cheers to Gandhi for not skimping on the spice.    They usually have several vegetarian options in the buffet and a number of delicious chicken dishes.  There's some real hit and miss going on with the dishes.  I loved the paneer in spicy butter cream and the chicken tikka masala.  And thumbs up for the naan and the okra dish.    That said, many of the dishes simply fall flat.  Problem is, at $12.95, this is one of the more expensive non-strip buffets and it is simply just not spectactular.

-9enZxqzstvk1alZFuYIbg.text: 5 star for Crystal. Very good service and really kind. We enjoyed the food and service. We'll comeback for sure.

kZF-cFwdB0I0Pgr6ndOd6A.text: Great service the staff was very friendly and it was very clean and welcoming. The food was amazing in my opinion best Indian food in Vegas! I recommend getting the Tikka Marsala it was very good and flavorful.

5YTEMk2O9PM2wFk90F4NeQ.text: Regulation Indian restaurant in the USA. Watered down food for the most part. But not bad.

z3xph58ok_Ox67jnxNHsOg.text: When we pulled up to this place for our 5 pm reservation I thought maybe it went out of business. There were a group of  5 guys smoking in front of a door that perhaps at one time was an entrance.Then there was another door where dresses and clothing was being  taken out of the building by the droves. I walked in through that door  and waited to be seated in side the resturant   The TV was blareing and after waiting 5 minnutes we finnaly were seated in an empty resturant with the exception of a large group of men sitting in a corner table staring at us.. There were dirty tables that had not be bussed and when the waiter came over with water to pour inside a dirty glass I stoped him and said..Thanks but No Thanks we are leaving..He asked if the prices are too high I replied I didnt even bother to look at the menu sorry and got up and left.y

7uKtvBBsD8blDKQzWF-8iw.text: Since I am in Vegas, I am enjoying all the buffets. Today I was craving Indian food and decided to visit with my friend. I really enjoyed the lunch buffet. The tandoori chicken was really tender and full of flavor. It was all hot and fresh and really good. A few dishes were a little spicy for me. But the naan was perfect. Customer service wasn't too bad, although they could use a little pep up. Perfect lunch to keep my energy going while we explored the Strip and went to see the fountains. I love Indian food because it sustains my energy for a long time. The place was super nice. I was impressed with how fancy it felt, but the lunch buffet was still an extremely inexpensive amount, especially coming from Hawaii where everything costs an arm and a leg. Thank you for a nice lunch and keep that buffet because I will visit every time I come back!

bfRbvQEhB1r_Kx1eNyrKDw.text: This place is as good as the other Indian restaurants that I've been to in Las Vegas. The food is very good, the portions are still small, but if I go with someone else, I can usually finish their plates as well. One thing that stands out is the decor...It is beautiful. High ceilings, Indian nick-knacks hanging all over the place, linen table cloths, etc. The service is fast, and the prices are in-line with other Indian Restaurants in the area. I will go back if I'm ever on that side of town again.

eu5YOKgCEl1Rov_5Y3q-ww.text: I have had the pleasure of enjoying Indian cuisine at a variety of Indian restaurants, but it wasn't until a friend of mine invited me for lunch to their buffet.  The food was amazing and since then I have been back several times for dinner.  Last night was no exception.  The food (Butter Chicken and Garlic Nan) was incredible. The service was outstanding and the prices very reasonable.  I would absolutely recommend the Gandhi Restaurant to anyone who is interested in having a great dinning experience . . . Really first class !!!

sWREWMkRIsUvT9bZQRxAwQ.text: This is the best Indian food in Vegas! Incredible service everytime! This place has a wonderful atmosphere, I never leave disappointed. They have the best Indian food I have ever tasted. Great family owned business. Honestly a must try!

qGiNCABWQ2o92kM7sxdklw.text: This place is so good. Im mexican and I rather have chicken tikka masala than burritod

KOTczQJxDvZfH96nU_k4Vw.text: The place was recommended by a friend who had visited Las Vegas 10 years ago. However, the place turned out to be really disappointed. I fail to understand how the restaurant has said open for 10 plus years. Curry was more watery, masala papad was super spicy (had to drink 2 glasses of water) & naan was rubbery. Would not recommend this place to anyone.

Gpss_b6bLKywy7RUym8wjw.text: The first Indian restaurant in 1993 and still providing excellent service for tourist and locals.

vqXT2P9gGiz5HEy2IAfqZA.text: Came for dinner.  The food was too oily and spicy, even for someone like me who enjoys the heat.  So spicy, I could barely taste the flavor of the food.  Very expensive, and the portions were so large, I felt like I was wasting food because I couldn't finish it.  Even though the place was almost empty, the service was really slow, and it was hard to find the wait staff to get their attention.

POirzdMkNYgqDHP2j2tDtw.text: My fiance and I were on a mini-vaca for the weekend. We had just gotten out of a UNLV game and had no idea where to eat. We didn't want to go back on the busy strip and came across Gandhi. I love Indian food and haven't seemed to find any I like since leaving Sacramento for Arizona.       We were there for holiday and so the restaurant was strictly buffet, which the owner said is not usually the case. The assortment of foods was the best I've seen on any buffet. Plenty of options for meat eaters and vegetarians alike. Everyone was friendly, in fact in some cases they were a little too on top of their game. Perhaps checking in on us a little too much.       We knew from the moment we walked in a saw the place packed that we were at the right spot. I will be back there and only wished I lived closer.

iBVwsyY_AFN2ZG8BIOmHHg.text: I've been going to (and ordering from) Gandhi India for over a decade and have always been very happy! Great options for meat eaters like me and for my vegetarian friends.

bwCfADNwwG7Yd12-zT8iTQ.text: Valerie A.P. I am from Seattle and visited Las Vegas last weekend.  My best friend's nephew has an excellent taste in restaurants and likes to take us to the "best restaurants in Las Vegas."  He was spot on with this choice!  Being from Seattle there are a lot of Indian restaurants and I have frequented many of them. I have to say that Ghandi has the best Indian food I have ever tasted!  The atmosphere is authentic and I loved the Indian music videos playing in the back ground.  The customer service is superb and they make you feel welcome as soon as you enter.  You must try the butter chicken - it was a hit with everyone a the table.  I am vegetarian, so my nephew ordered the sauce that goes on top for my naan.  I personally recommend the vegetable Biriyani.  Bon appetite!

gOCwwH1MCL7fIccz5KnOIg.text: This place is ok not the best I have had in Vegas could do with a renovation.food is very salty and to much oil.

G6-fnIcB7M_871r3-qd3dA.text: Excellent food! Very authentic. Service is excellent. If you are in Vegas and want Indian food, this is the place for you.

hXEsdtDuiBGI-zcZtf6JDw.text: The food is beyond delicious and the service is friendly. Krissy was so nice and accomdating. This isn't our first visit and won't be our last.

sqf4p3JDwK0jOtyVpj8sog.text: The food was amazing. The decoration was impressive. The variety was great lots of different things to choose from even dishes for vegetarians. As I stated the decor I can't say enough what a lovely place.

4O3fqvo9EJpZA-tWWCyYuA.text: We had a very bad experience when we had our dinner at Gandhi today. The samosa was dripping in oil and tasteless. We couldn't eat. The server took the price of the bill. The tandoori roti was dripping with oil even though we specifically requested no oil. The Sag paneer and mixed veggie dishes were overloaded with butter. Large pieces of butter were still floating in the dishes when brought to the table. Even the plain white rice had too much butter. Overall, a tasteless and unhealthy dinner that spoiled our evening. We will not go there again for sure.

wjBnan-qpWpweAg6vBlM6w.text: My husband, daughter and I went to this restaurant today for lunch. It was 2:30 pm and there were approximately 20 people already in the restaurant eating.  When we were waiting to be seated one of the staff members came to tell us they were closing. It's 2:30 in the afternoon why would they be closing early on a Saturday? Also, their website states they close at 11 pm so that was really weird. I had to look down to see the color of my skin to figure out why they were all of a sudden closing so early. But that's okay, I would much rather give my hard earned money to a company that respect and values their customers regardless of  what race they are. I drove about a mile up the street to another restaurant called India Oven Masala. I had no issues there. Their food was great and their service was awesome as well. So I will definitely recommend going to that restaurant instead.

7BpD9xbiap8ara-2qITN-A.text: Great hidden local Indian Restaurant. Fantastic garlic nan. Great northern buffet with rotating daily dishes. Tali plates (silver plates) available instead of normal white plates. Cool option. More authentic.

2xIbXlHUvreZfaqItPYNhQ.text: The server had a rude face . And gave bad service . He stand in the corner and uses his phone .   Will not return

w94ol2mMH_1FhHzLkoMZZQ.text: It took a lot of courage to eat here after seeing that they were recently shut down due to a cockroach infestation.  Apparently they were featured on a show called "dirty dining" as well.  Well, their proximity to my hotel and the lack of good Indian food where I live allowed me to make a very trepidatious visit.  Sadly, not worth it.  The food was very much on the bland side, service was amateur, and when I presented them the Yelp 10% discount, they requested that I give them a positive review.  Well, here's your review guys.   Other things of note, the restaurant was nearly empty on a Saturday night at 7pm, and the restrooms could have been cleaner.  Fortunately, I saw no evidence of roaches in my palak paneer, but I certainly paused to wonder if they might have inadvertently been serving a few cockroach curries that evening.  The food did not sit well in my stomach.

hYBQnqui1BA69xy1bpmZJA.text: Poor service. Waiters don't come to the table for over 20 minutes. You have to constantly beckon them for service - whether it is to take your order or bring the condiments or fill the glass of water or bring the check. And the place wasn't even crowded. Only 4 tables were occupied. Food is of sub standard quality. The lamb biryani had tough lamb that was undercooked and extremely hard to chew. The goat dish was full of bones. The chicken dish was tasteless. Never going back there. This link says it all: ktnv.com/news/dirty-dini...

H3slU-miPzBF24D0tOXzDQ.text: YES five stars. I'm extremely picky. I wanted Indian food and wanted to go to an Indian place after a twelve hour shift tonight that wasn't regular wanted to be in a romantic setting AND have VERY tasty food at the same time. I've eaten Indian food for only about 7 years now. Not very long. Every. Single. Time. I've gotten chicken tikka masala and yes I'll say it was good. And for Gandhi I was expecting the same reaction. But tonight. Me and my boyfriend come to this spot, & it was very quiet and hidden, come in and dine in a completely eye opening experience. I ACTUALLY WAS SURPRISED FROM BEGINNING TO END. the food is so flavorful yet so simplistic. You don't ask questions. You get off of a twelve hour shift step away and experience what these beautiful workers are going to feed you I love it. On top of that we got let's just say a "kind gesture" (but see for yourself to see what that is) from who appeared to be the manager because they recently re-opened in June! This worker let us know the restaurant re-renovated their entire kitchen in May 2018. Also that they were and are the very first Indian restaurant in Vegas opening at as early as 1993!!!!! I was -2 at the time. (Eye opening much??? Um......This is my place for life now no  questions....) they also have had the same chef SINCE. That says BIG things because I haven't had to die for (like LA) Indian food yet. And mind you I've tried multiple places. Lived here two years now. This place is not a miracle. NO. It's just a GREAT PLACE with GREAT FOOD. GREAT ATMOSPHERE. GREAT PEOPLE. GREAT PRICES UNLIKE THESE OTHER PLACES. basically it's a place that backs their sh** up  if I leave a restaurant feeling nostalgia....... THAT MEANS SOMETHING YOU GUYS DESERVE THIS REVIEW. There's only so many places I eat at and leave but can't stop reminiscing to. Seriously not many. you guys are MY hidden gem.

EfuSfSOtI13zt61e_InQyw.text: The food is over-the-top delicious. I really enjoyed the lunch buffet. Ate too much, and had to skip desert.

yN7Gmhf7aKENl_J94Myacw.text: TL;DR: adequate food best served at a rarely-used regional airport.  We've been looking forward to going to this restaurant for a long time, so we had high expectations for the dinner.  How to quantify he disappointment? Well, imagine being told that you were going to meet a great Indian leader named Gandhi, only to find that it was Sonia, Indira's son's wife, not the Mahatma. Sure, it would be neat to meet the president of the Congress Party, but, still.  We chose two dishes: chicken korma and lamb biryani.  The korma was passable in a pinch, but the biryani was a disaster.  Biryani is supposed to have delectable pieces of meat, slowly cooked to a tender, savory consistency. The lamb in this dish tasted and felt as though it was re-used from a prior day (or recycled from the lunch buffet); tough, slightly dry, and almost flavorless.  Regarding the korma, in our experience korma has a very rich and savory taste, almost buttery, that fills the mouth. This dish was ok, but had a slightly greasy aftertaste. The gravy (if that's the right term) was thin and only vaguely flavorful.  Also, and this may be a small issue, but why separate charges for the oily jasmine rice?  Ambiance: we were assaulted by what I can only term "Indian Booty Music" when we entered the establishment. We're familiar with Bollywood-style music and music videos; what was playing, however, was some mixture of Beyonce's Lemonade and Brittany Spear's snake dance and Indian music.  It was loud and obnoxious, but it was turned down quite a bit after we entered.  The decorating was done as an homage to the second Matrix movie.  We were the first guests of the evening, and only two couples arrived while we were there.  Perhaps it's the location (next to a series disgusting small shops), but the entire joint has a slightly seedy vibe, and maybe that's what's causing the problems the owners clearly are having with this place.

vCJmDV70b8dmg7jbYslqRQ.text: Best Indian food I've had in Vegas. The buffet has a ton of veggie options. Very flavorful. Polite staff.

NdpKY4yoWmzIbBfO-LsllQ.text: We took delivery of the food last night. We have  ordered paratha but we got a kind of tandoori roti with some oil applied to it which we could not eat. We shared the photo with the owner but the owner rold that is paratha only. So I would suggest do not go to the restaurant ever.

boXOHzhOMwOi-bx5Qn42Kg.text: Had a great experience here tonight.  Waiter very attentive, manager very helpful, the inside is beautiful, and food was EXCELLENT!  We've lived in Vegas for 2 years, love Indian food, and I'm not going to or ordering from anywhere other than here, starting now.

TJh6DW1yHeUmjHTKsnW53w.text: Some of the best chicken and curry I have tasted. The chicken especially, is always tender and the perfect texture and flavor at all times. My go to place for indian cuisine.

NtRzUYT1ajYHv27NuSDCYQ.text: This was my first Indian restaurant, honestly I'm not a big fan of spicy food. This is the reason I'm giving it 4 stars. Decoration was beautiful, and our waiter was very hospitable. He assisted my friends and I to understand the menu and select our dishes. Unfortunately, spicy food isn't my thing but my friends sure did enjoy their food. If you love spicy, this is definitely the place for you.

y7DSiGLVqsSOF4VmI_l4ug.text: Lots of tasty vegetarian dishes even though I'm a meat lover, I was quite surprised that the lunch buffet was more than enough. Spices were just right, flavorful and a plethora of dishes including dessert. I would have given it a 4-star but the location and atmosphere needs improvement. Be prepared to walk away satisfied and extremely full.

tjkMMRk_c66FKBGmVEmS8Q.text: We have tried many Indian restaurants in the Las Vegas- Henderson area. We have been back to Gandhi now 3 times... The food is excellent. We have tried different things each time we've come in and been very pleased with the flavors and variety of dishes they offer.  The service was very attentive.   It's in an area where there are many food establishments and the parking doesn't ever seem to be a problem. Easy to get to since its in the 'off the strip' area! Five stars from my family and myself!!!

iEbnsKH0kx8T2M46rpzdSA.text: The food was pretty awful and at the end of our meal my hands were literally yellow, we asked the manager what it was and she casually said it was food color. Not only was she nonchalant about it but suggested using alcohol to remove it. I would recommend eating anywhere else in the Las Vegas besides this place !! Trust me do not waste your time and money on this place. I wish they had negative stars for places like this.

RH95vcX2_kDESwDMln7yqQ.text: Visited this restaurant with my wife. Both of us liked a food a lot especially daal and potato beans. Highly recommended if you visit Las Vegas and also price is reasonable.

owma03Lia75_67r7Ug-RuA.text: So I gave this place another chance for dinner and lunch. It was pretty good still not a big fan of the obvious downgrade on the silverware department but the food was much better keep it up :)

L7-ZN_0O4ODhNRSzklbDRg.text: Went to Gandhi India Cuisine eat Buffet dinner after Golf Tournament.  I do not eat meat, only seafood and Vegetables.  I had asked the owner make sure they had enough fish.  He did a great job and had best fish.  Crystal the Manager made the experience "Awesome".

DTva5cFUUdrk6L8YEScvew.text: bit of a misfire. Should consider adding butter-free rice if they are going to have so many vegan dishes. Indian food without rice is too overpowering for most palates. Also, the waiter should not have argued with us that we didn't order our second dish and should have just said "sorry about that, will bring it right out". It's impossible for some people to fathom that they might be wrong or might not have heard something. It's ok to admit the possibility of fault... we're all only human.

k-aNIAC4qnybllQehSE-Iw.text: My wife and I have been coming to this restaraunt since 2009 for one very important reason.. they treat us like family.  We've experienced other Indian venues, but according to my taste buds, nothing compares.  The food is great if you are into strong herbs and spices.  I dont know what is in most dishes, but thats not important if the grub is smack good!  ...I know one of my faves is Chicken Masala. They have a selective buffet from 12pm - 2pm for $11.95 which is a great option for those who want to dib and dab here and there to see if this kind of cuisine is your thing.  The interior is exotic and the music is indian pop which all adds to the dining experience.  When you come in, ask for a server named  Megiddo, i swear he is Ghandi reincarnated!

BdAX_3y-8jm8h7tNf-oj1A.text: Small quaint restaurant.  Authentic Indian food. Impressive selection of dishes, Buffett style.    Tastes wonderful.  Friendly service and great prices.

d8hW5ITX22TwTqeVu72MLw.text: Good value for your buck. Very close to the strip.

WWAKwbD2qFxYcwgtFRsSMw.text: When we entered the restaurant, the buffet time was almost over. Erik kept the buffet on hold for us and even arranged for fresh and hot roti. Totally adds a star to our trip to Vegas.

XQz3_XEMmiueFlzGCEHGtA.text: We came across this restaurant quite by chance as we were enjoying a happy hour drink across the road & felt like having Indian food.  My boyfriend is EXTREMELY particular about his food & HE gave the food a "10"! The lamb ib the Rogan Josh was "melt-in-your-mouth" soft, chicken tikka, very succulent & the eggplant dish, perfect!   I see this restaurant got a 3.5 stars on Yelp, but personally speaking, it should be a lot higher. We will definitely be back!

Gj66eSNtlrUVAB0To7yg0Q.text: Woman cannot live from liquor alone so at some point I had to eat.  Being a pissed off hungry vegetarian in a city catered to meat eaters, I began to feel aggressive.  Then I drove down Paradise Road and saw a sign that read Gandhi.   I remembered the concept of ahimsa all of a sudden, took a deep breath, and figured that the food gods were on my side.  I walked inside and saw meat on the plates of other patrons.  I was mildly annoyed since Gandhi was a vegetarian and I normally would have been a pain in the ass about it, but I was so desperate for food that I was willing to sacrifice my principles for the good of my stomach.  I asked the server if there were a few vegetarian dishes present at the buffet, and he smiled and proceeded to show me the goods.  After correctly guessing that I am from California (a vegetarian twenty-something with a serious sense of entitlement, where else could I be from?) I proceeded to eat this excellent, varied, and overpriced lunch, surrounded by friendly staff who were attentive but not overbearing.  I had such a great meal that I made my friends go there with me again the next day.  I highly recommend this place to vegetarian tourists.

otJtr8ORCq8PESM431R4zg.text: Guys please AVOID this place at least for Buffet..!!!! I'm not allowed to give No rating else would have done that..  we just came back from Vegas & I couldn't stop myself from writing review for this place. Being an Indian knows how Indian food taste, smell,looks like. Believe me it was nothing like that. The menu was OK nothing fancy for the price you pay. Here is list of items in Vegetarian sect: Yellow daal  Rajma (any damn indian can make that better than what they had) Shahi Panner (tasted just like Heinz ketchup) Aloo Baigan (Big chunk of uncook potatoes) Naan (It took forever to get them, we told them 5 times that there is no naan & how are we supposed to eat all above items) Rice (we didnt cared about that as we left within 10 mins of our so called lunch Bufftet) Onion Pakora (Cold Pakora, have you ever ate one) Idli - (Hard as stone,  they made it 2 days ago to serve it. ) Sambhar (Sambhar was way tooo spicy & trust me when an Indian says too spicy it is...:)  The service is really really really bad. They dont care that you want something or not. They were behaving as if they are doing big favor on us by attending us. ohhh guys cmon .!!! Its one of the Buffet you never want to waste your money. Believe me.!!

SPaoSKJx7z9rfPN3LA4kww.text: We have been going here for over 8 years. The food is always good and the service is excellent. When we have a craving for Indian food, we make the trek from Summerlin rather than looking for a new restaurant close to home. We are usually the only non-Indians in the restaurant which is typically a good indication that the food is authentic.

SID5SeNsNsMu_ZTjeoSvWQ.text: Great food , avg. price. Spicy enough to stimulate your taste buds. Good service. Great  tomato soup , bhindi masala, chana masala , naan, jeera  rice , dal. Great interior. Location and view  from outside dose not reflect that this is located in Las Vegas.  Dull and dark from outside.  Definitely will go again.

4aBiglIcVBTM0Dtycn6j6Q.text: Absolutely delicious and always fresh. I go here a couple times a week for lunch, since my office is just around the corner. Always friendly and attentive service.

gpghkAJwC5a9eMWfyIdG9Q.text: I go for the buffet. I have no idea what I'm eating but it tastes great.  The service is excellent!

3kPTXWZRgtTRsfOgMr0A-w.text: This review is for the lunch buffet only.    I've never been dissappointed.  Well, that's not True.  I'm on the verge of tears when they run out of naan, which is a frequent occurrence for the lunch buffet.  But, it's one of my favored lunchtime stops.  Plenty of vegeterian options, and they have enough variety that it's rarely same combination of dishes.  They really won me over with their okra dish... Magnificient!  Muah!  That's what sticks out in my head the most, so I guess the rest is good but not necessarily spectactular.  It is in a somewhat seedy strip mall, but heck, some of Vegas' greats share that characteristic, Lotus of Siam anyone?  Interior decor I find quite pleasing.  The lunch buffet will run you around $12.50, so middle of the road pricewise, too.  I think this belong on your list if you're racking up your checklist of Vegas' Indian buffets.

36L0rCCu3pySJ4JI4AGf2A.text: The tomato soup was out of the world. The most delicious I ever had. Better than many restaurents in India !

mp8xfXmN3ZoKKuYKg3-qcA.text: I went to this place as I want to support a reopened restaurant.We are vegetarian.  Service & quality have to be improved. New owner's presence is a must otherwise he may have to close it again.

q5C4eydCQmSJ_89meNdq7w.text: If you are looking for authentic Indian Punjabi food you must check out this restaurant. Forget about all other fancy restaurants who serve bland Indian food. This is True Punjabi authentic food.

kGh2LDfxWvIesYipfqCL-w.text: Way too expensive buffet for very less items and were tasting very bad. It was $25 per person and there were no special items like biryani. Sambar was tasting like it was made ages ago. Very disappointed. I would not recommend this. And all the labels to the dishes were placed wrong.

_IdV3VimBYg4pMTaNm14yg.text: Service poor. Food was old stock that was reheated . Some portion of Eggplant potato curry was too hot and some of it too cold. Pakoras were uncooked inside. Nan was never served. Rest was less than ordinary. Save your stomach and money

_B5JMtSbSZBciHdbIZL_cA.text: We just arrived from Orlando and went to this restaurant. The experience was not great from service to food. We ordered couple of plates of lamb biryani and it did not taste like biryani and tasted like yellow rice turned white and some meat tossed in it. The serves were also very small for the price we paid. We spent over $100 and it was not its value from a quality and service perspective.  Hope we received better service and quality Indian food.

Kz7vbXUszgWNvJiLCrKqRA.text: Wow!  Just loved everything about this experience.  The food was very delicious, the waiters were constantly making sure we had enough water, were satisfied with our food, and were otherwise taken care of.  The decoration of the place is cool, too - definitely not what you'd expect looking at it from the outside.  And, for all you vegetarians/vegans, there's plenty to eat here - and though I can't remember what dish I had (the waiter picked it out for me), it was SO good!  Definitely a spot I'll come back to.

qTyAMVAjEjeT3eaNae6N2Q.text: Delivery was pretty quick especially for a large order. We had 5 different dishes and two desserts. Everything was better than average. Peas were missing from our rice but that's not a big deal. The Bryani was very good.   Thanks

OeGXpTonp5-TMVKz20McpA.text: I Love Gandhis! I've been there quite a few times and I have never had a bad experience. We usually visit during dinner, but we have also gone during lunch buffet. I prefer dinner because there is more options to order, but my husband enjoys having a visual so he likes the buffet. The food is great. I love the Chicken Tikka Masala and the Mango Lassi. I really just can't complain. It's our go-to for Indian cuisine.   I also really like what they've done with the place. It looks more put together.

photos.caption: Photo of Gandhi India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Feast!

FmiIkKXZnnOAkQOZKaCjaA.text: Really good food! Crystal was a really great server. Very helpful, kind and friendly.

nwXxYxOzXrKE7xzjM5gwMg.text: Okay, so I'll be honest, I have not eaten at a whole bunch of other Indian restaurants.  That being said, the lunch buffet is absolutely delicious.  I am relatively new to Indian food, and my friend told me I had to try this hidden gem.    The restaurant itself is squeezed behind an Albertsons (next to a wig shop) but don't let that deter you!  Inside is very nice, and open.  Everything I had on the buffet was delicious (and I tried a little bit of almost everything!) and the servers kept our water glasses full and our table clear of abandoned plates.  I would definitely recommend this to others, and I will return (if only for the tikka masala...omg so delicious).  My friend told me that regionally, this restaurant favored the northern styles of cooking and most of the others nearby are more southern in orientation.  So keep that in mind if this is not entirely what you expected.  I found everything to be delicious.  I've been stuffed for hours. Give it a shot.  :)

Iu7X5SBSYNx1xTo_8HammQ.text: Our service was excellent . Our service was well delivered by our server Crystal. The atmosphere was very relaxing and the food was superbly delicious! If you love Indian food, this establishment should be one of your top priorities to come and visit.

fmnq7dL1c8Px23Uo_4FLtA.text: Great food, with knowledgeable and fun staff.   I felt very welcome and looked after by Paul, Gerard and Jaz!  I had the Chicken Biriyani, spiced to perfection and the naan bread was SO fresh!  Don't be deterred that is it is buried in a strip mall, it is a 'find'.   I am coming back with a big group of chaps next Jan. for the Consumer Electronics Show.   I don't write many reviews, but this place is special.

rBPp7DV62kQ1uOJodq15uQ.text: I had a very nice buffet here this afternoon! The food was very good, especially the tandoori chicken! Most buffet style tandoori is dry, but this was delicious! I enjoyed the butter chicken with rice, not very spicy so perfect for those of who who can't handle the heat. The veggie pakora had maybe been out too long, they were a little mushy, but still had a good flavor.

rL5vNJecTpBy1Q5vZmQyzQ.text: I ate here the other day.. Ilike it. Food was good and so was the service. One of best indian cuisine

nhBQkz_Asnj9HT0KQA8MUw.text: I came here with some of my family friends becuase one of their kids had a project about Indian culture. So, we decided to come here to try their food. To be honest I didn't know what to expect about this place, but I just have to say that I had such a wonderful experience.   - Great environment  (cool music)  - Great food; very colorful and so delicious!  - Great service from the staff   * If you are willing to try something out of your "comfortable" zone and you like to experiment with diverse dishes from around the world this is a great place to start!  * For those who expect a "luxurious" place to eat this place might not be what you are looking for, but this restaurant is so welcoming and very peaceful.  * I have to say that this review is specifically about the buffet, so I can't really judge how's the their entire menu  My warm regards to the staff members and the chef!

LFbzKVSGR2k_m_gAoRt7lQ.text: This place got one of the best food you can find in the area. Lot of items to choose from and every item got best taste to it. Customer service is also really good. If you are in the area, you should definitely stop by and check this place out

B8hOksyXyNEHQV89VCPL2Q.text: Last night i went for a dinner with my family, the food is awesome. Everything taste so perfect as if its like melting in mouth and excellent service. UGpGBj_7yDGMlC8BpFcOSQ.text: Went for buffet lunch. The food is ok and reasonable. The variety is good (maybe a dish or two more for the vegetarians needed). Decor is ok. Adult price is 11.95 and Kids is 8.95. Great for out-of-towners who crave Indian food.

At any rate the food at Ghandi is mediocre and overpriced: $11.99 for the lunch buffet, loaded with bland vegetarian dishes and a few chicken-scrap entrees.  Oh, well, I may try another Indian restaurant in Las Vegas, though I may just wait until the next time I'm in San Francisco.

All of the dishes are prepared with quality in mind. This Yelper likes the $11 lunch!!

OQmLsdOfUvoMjkYHBTNjWA.text: The buffet was amazing and the service was prompt.  Lamb curry was tender and delicious.  The samosa was the best I have ever had and the mango custard was a perfect finish.  I would highly recommend this restaurant.

uzZyrDHwPzyselXw7t7pSA.text: I've been a fan of this place for several years.  My trips to Las Vegas are not complete until I've visited the buffet.  The quality has been the same all the time, the taste has always been great, and the people there are very friendly.  I don't frequent an indian restaurant in Los Angeles as much as I have in Las Vegas.  Looking forward to more food next time I go.

CS5tDr1SeD3PurR82Gd7Xw.text: This is based on my recent visit (end of Sept. 2011), food there was delicious. Specially Butter Chicken and Paneer Masala.... yum! Me and my wife were amazed on how good tasting both entrees were... for a buffet!

gii-EueV3JED24nkMEqrCw.text: Went here for lunch with a couple of co-workers. I've also tried the chicken cury from my co-worker's plate.  The food is very good and is as authentic as it can get.  I love eating food from a places that has exotic and authentic cruisines.   I also love the Indian beer as well.  Forgot the name of the beer but it was very good.

Npw_RYHQaTwIx5bEBYtZBA.text: Amazing food and beautiful decor. Really enjoyed my visit and will definitely go again!

UBevEcJcHejoPNr3H4rPGQ.text: Kinda marginal Indian food - why go here when you go down Paradise to Origin India which is GREAT. uGeJhDsNoKHA7XcltbbftA.text: Whoever gave this place more then one star has never eaten Indian food before! The food was very bland, and expensive, $30 for 2, including 2 soft drinks for a lunch buffet. Besides being very bland there was a serious issue of meat!!! There was almost none, just a little bit of chicken in their dishes, and the tandoori chicken left a lot to be disired. Thats it, no beef somosas or lamb or goat!  This was my second time here, the first was 10yrs ago, sadly the place hasn't improved...

aGZwVp9adyBNa3kYvRDanA.text: Crystal was an amazing waitress and the food was so freaking awesome!! Thank you for such a great experience! I will definitely be back and recommend this place to everyone !!!

H1srERRvO9pKpouhWyFWJg.text: I stopped by for a quick bite on my way to the convention center which is just down the street. There is a WOW factor here that doesn't seem to exist in the other India restaurants I've eaten.  The lunch buffet had something for everyone from vegetarians to meat and fish eaters. The Butter Makhanwala Chicken was perfectly spiced.  The Ponjobi Curry took me back to my Far East travels and the Naan bread was light and buttery.  The atmosphere is comfy with large private booths that can comfortably seat 8 to 10.  If you have never been here, or haven't been since their new renovations in May, now is the time to check it out before the word gets out and you'll be having to make reservations to take your turn.

56DwiHlDTorotz39qAjENg.text: The food here is so amazing and the customer service was great as well. The night we came, it was buffet style. Every dish was so good, hot and fresh. I will def recommend this place to friends.

MPBh9YWmsW8mgRefs4HWhw.text: Nice Indian restaurant in Las Vegas. They have buffet for lunch and great food. My family loves coming to this restaurant every time we come here. I recommend it to everybody.

I9ukBAYNXltO_0wzagff3g.text: When we arrived, the area looked a bit shady and the restaurant looked small. But let me tell you this is one of the best Indian buffet that I've had in a long time. I stayed at Edison, NJ for more than 3yrs and my expectation of Indian food in tge US is really high. I can tell you that this restaurant was right up there in terms of food quality, taste, cost, etc.   Definitely recommend if you're in the vicinity and looking for some Indian food.

uzVpNN4mTd2UE36yg9VYAg.text: Disappointed as I didn't get the authentic Indian experience I was looking for. We ordered paneer pakora as appetizer and kadhai paneer for main course. The pakoras (fritters) tasted more like plain cottage cheese cubes. It seems the paneer was not well marinated, was directly dipped in batter and fried. The batter also didn't coat the paneer cubes well leaving lot of raw paneer taste in mouth. The kadhai paneer wasn't authentic and tasted more like paneer cooked with a Chinese style sweet and sour sauce.

AnZxvy-aTgSuoikG7lLdxA.text: Worst place ever .. food was cold, waited for 40 min for cold and tasteless food to come.. eventually walked out while waiting for dessert to come... if there is less than one star, I certainly would have given it.. NOT GOING THERE EVER.. stay away... I don't believe they understand what a customer service is?

5rI3pojGO1RpDq3njYxQdg.text: Dined at Gandhi for the first time in quite a while to use a groupon. I remember dining at Gandhi many years ago and it was not my favorite Indian place in town, but I figured we would give it another try. We liked the interior a lot. Very high ceilings, roomy and it was nice and chilly inside, which was nice on a super hot summer evening. We were sat right away and the host greeted us with a "hello sir", no acknowledgment of my female guest, but other than that he was pleasant and accommodating. The person who came to take out order approached us and we weren't sure if he worked there or not because he was just in regular street clothes and stood there for a moment without saying anything. He seemed very tired or maybe stoned, which was kind of funny, but it made for an awkward experience. He also only acknowledged me. We placed our order and he tried to talk us into a couple of other things, fair enough. He asked if we wanted the naan bread with butter or not, which I have never been asked before while eating Indian food. I said no thanks, just bring it out how it normally comes. The vegetable samosas and vegetable pakoras were awesome. For our main course we shared mushroom mutter and saag paneer with naan bread and rice. The main dishes were crazy buttery. I mean, the main flavor we could taste was butter. I like butter, but when that is the main flavor that we are tasting, something isn't quite right. Also, the naan bread had butter, which I did not ask for. We were checked on several times by the host and the server and again and again they never acknowledged my female guest. I guess when they ask "how is everything sir" they only care about me and not her.   3 stars isn't a terrible score, because this place isn't terrible, it's just ok. The service is a bit awkward and the food was decent, but not my favorite here in LV. A couple of suggestions 1) Maybe the servers should introduce themselves as the person that will be taking the guests order 2) Acknowledge all of the guests at the table "hi, how are you two doing?" And not just the male 3) Pull back a bit on the butter.

A2P7Rc2DSRFTkEVZmnijdg.text: This restaurant is listed as vegan and I have developed severe dietary restrictions so I was excited to give it a try. We stopped in for lunch but I have to admit I was not wowed by the buffet options. I ended up ordering the veggie biryani, pretty much the only vegan option besides lentil soups. My fiance, who is not restricted like me loved it! So omnivores, I'm sure this is a good bet.

RmNKU9UlteDYmYabNi5dpQ.text: The food was good, first time trying Indian cuisine. The staff was very nice and made sure we were satisfied. Plan on going back

y8qwfcMR_jxKMNqQraVaaQ.text: My husband and I came here for dinner.  Totally ignored as soon as we walked in the door.  FINALLY....a server said to just sit anywhere    Then sat at table for several minutes with absolutely no attention given to us at all.  The restaurant was buffet style and they where not that busy.  We just recently moved here from Tennessee and found many many Indian restaurants in this area.  I'm sad that the service was so poor.  We ended having to get up and leave after being there about 15 minutes    I want to express that the place is small and people working there absolutely totally ignored us.

jL5-evppuwGvg8gB5XAMNQ.text: "Well, now we know why it was totally empty," my boyfriend said as we walked to our car after dinner here. We went in because I caught sight of it out of the corner of my eye while driving by and hadn't heard of it. That should have been a warning sign but instead I took it as an opportunity. Unfortunately, this spot was very disappointing: overpriced and subpar.  Interior is well decorated and the high ceilings are nice, unexpectedly nice considering the strip-mall exterior. Menu prices are a bit high with most dishes ~$20. This would be okay if portions were larger or if rice was included, as at most Indian restaurants.   We ordered the goat curry, saag paneer, and garlic naan- all dishes we love and get regularly. The goat was among the toughest I've ever had, the paneer was flavorless, and even the naan was rather lacking. Dishes were brought out in small bowls without rice, which was not offered or mentioned in any way to indicate that it was not included, and had to be requested. Our bill was about $50 for mediocrity, but they do offer a 10% off Yelp check-in discount.
