What I want to say is that this guy is the world's worst waiter but is so intimidating that I wouldn't dare complain about it (to his face). Their prices are too high for low quality food. PvIQZSdSFbuMRpwQh_Q-nw.text: Bacchanal buffet my ass! Gandhi buffet it is!   The food tastes fresh, there is variety and its delicious!! What's not to like for a hungover group of 10 guys! When a buffet costs $14-15, you would think they would invest in cutlery. Nope. although the plates are ceramic(very light), the cups are 'take-out' material cups and the spoons look metallic but they are 'faux' metal spoons. The fork bent while cutting into my idli, haha. Come on guys, invest a bit more.   Will be back.

08BItu2zC8zch5xvOg8DOQ.text: What happened here??  When I was here for dinner a little over a year ago, the buffet (the matter paneer in particular) was fan-flippin-tastic.  Service was great, the food was amazing, and I swore an oath to myself that I would somehow come back here.  I was in Vegas with my fiance this past weekend and, even though he's not big on Indian food, I talked him into having dinner here because of how good it was.  Womp Womp.  Did they change ownership??  There's no such thing as a dinner buffet anymore.  "Well, I can't eat embarrassing amounts at the buffet, but at least I can order the matter paneer off the menu," I thought.  There was one nice host/busser, one food runner, and one disinterested waiter, which got to be a problem as the dinner crowd picked up.  The naan was sub-par; more burnt air bubbles than anything.  My beloved matter paneer was totally different.  It wasn't bad.  Actually, it was pretty decent, but nowhere near as good as it used to be.  We sat at the table, done eating, plates cleared, for a loooong time before I was able to practically tackle the waiter to get our check.  Had I never been here before, this would have been a 2.5-rounded-up-to-3-stars-to-be-generous experience.  But knowing what was and what could have been, this mostly left me disappointed and apologizing to my fiance for misleading him.

E_G1hP7CCd_cGOVV71fMGQ.text: Well, I'm sad to review that Gandhi is no longer what it used to be. Not sure what may have changed but, I unfortunately won't be eating there any time soon. I used to eat here often as I love Indian food. The buffet was plentiful and always fresh. Now, its not so fresh and the food hardly has any flavor.  I remember just salivating at the anticipation of going there for lunch as everything was so good!! Now, instead all I had to look forward to was an upset belly once I got back to the office.  The salad that used to be crisp and fresh is now wilted and soggy. The tomatoes, well, what can I say except "nasty".  I'm sad that this happened as I loved going to Gandhi but, until I hear otherwise I won't be back for a long while if at all.  I guess Mt. Everest Indian Restaurant will be receiving my business now.

6bYg7cidf7UlXs_EAvpl6g.text: On a visit to Vegas with friends, we stumbled upon Gandhi. That was many years ago, and now it's a tradition for us to visit (at least once) each time we're in town. I can't figure out why their rating isn't higher. The service is great, the restaurant is gorgeous, and the food is so so yummy, whether it's the expansive lunch buffet or the succulent entrees for dinner. It's one of my all-time favorite Indian restaurants anywhere.

kzd9oK5IrOWEKulqEL-Y8g.text: This place has exceptional food and even more importantly, extremely welcoming and outstanding service! I've been here countless times but never got around to writing a review, so here goes:  I came here with a group of people and we started off with some vegetable pakoras which were perfectly crispy, yet not dry, as well as tandoori chicken which was served heaping on a sizzling plate and was bursting with flavor. They're definitely a must for me and I keep coming back to those two every time I come here.  For the main meal, I shared a thali with one other person. I especially enjoyed the Matar Paneer, which was delightfully tangy and spicy without being overwhelmingly so, as well as the Aloo Gobi, which was cooked to perfection -- delicate and tender, but not mushy. During the meal, the owner came out and greeted us and even had a special type of kulcha made just for us! To be honest, I can't think of any other places where restaurant owners would give so much time and attention to their customers.  Finally, our group finished off with some generous servings of kulfi, which we were told was made fresh in the kitchen! It had a really nice creamy coconut-ty flavor and was the perfect way to end our meal. I definitely recommend the kulfi to anyone who eats here. I'm not too big on coconut on sweets, but this dessert is one of very few exceptions.  From beginning to end, my experience here was truly spectacular. Unfortunately, I'm not from the area and I haven't been able to find any other Indian restaurants in my area good enough to satisfy my cravings. I always look forward to coming here whenever I'm in Vegas. Next time I'm in town, you know where to find me!

SwHigdxMKFnXoa3OmUDndQ.text: Worst choice for lunch, no items at 2:00 PM and half the items are empty Only 1 rice item ... your guess is right , it's white rice. Small changes and they could be the best place to eat indian food in Vegas.

-3NyTML_0zHsxP5guPNhXg.text: Awesome food. We came here for buffet, such a wide variety of snacks, entrees and deserts. Everything tasted so good. I will highly recommend this place.

2VYCZ4fHZM2q1be0YALfKg.text: Crystal was an amazing server! She gave us fantastic recommendations for vegan dishes and was very pleasant and attentive. The food was absolutely amazing but we are definitely coming back more because of her incredible service. Best Indian restaurant in Vegas!

LlFGnQ0J_p_o67Zz9f6UWA.text: My son and I had dinner at Gandhi tonight. It was a very cool and hip atmosphere. The place definitely picked through the course of our dinner. Wait staff was very personable and helpful. The food was absolutely delicious. We ordered Chicken Tikka Masala and Dal Makhani and Nan. We thoroughly enjoyed every aspect of our evening. This restaurant comes highly recommended.  It is a little tricky to access, as there are no U turns surrounding it. Be patient, you will be glad you finally made it to the parking lot.  Connie and Hayden B

photos.caption: Photo of Gandhi India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Tikka Masala and Dal Makhani

72t_jW2kkjIOuJn4498hZA.text: Why was I surprised, after all this place has many two star review. I guess because I've eaten here before and thought the food was pretty good. But there's more to a restaurant than the quality of the food. So briefly here's my prob with this place.   First, they raise their prices when they feel it's appropriate - Christmas week. Yes, the week, not the day. How do you justify with no additional menu items? Next, Naan is part of the buffet and good but dry - most buffets serve fresh naan at the table. There was no patek paneer - I know, amazing huh? Finally, the plastic silverware was just too much. $15 buffet with plastic silverware!

HMiQE6w2X7fExgF4_5ydfw.text: If you're looking for authentic Indian food this is a great restaurant. I've eaten at several Indian restaurants in the valley and this is by far my favorite. I only gave 4 stars because sometimes the staff doesn't pay proper attention to the tables. However, that has never deterred me from visiting this restaurant time and time again.

IvRmrHIA9aGPEp-rWS7wzA.text: Food is too spicy...... !! This place is good for vegetarian . Not enough selection for meat / desert also.  But lunch buffet Price is reasonable.

pf_b1pPBU9Me2xRpgxe3UQ.text: Enjoyed a great dinner. Food was absolutely delicious. The decor of the restaurant is really cool. It took a little longer than most Indian restaurants to get our food. The people were very nice, but the service was a tiny bit lacking. I will be back.

S_5SVfO6qqcvnUDeJreltQ.text: I love this place! The food is fantastic as is the friendly service. My favorite is the chicken tikka masala. Located in a strip mall off the Strip, it's a nice change from the crowded casino restaurants. I'll be back!

07137UC1Hj_lOyKmhG9zcA.text: From the moment you walk in until the moment you leave you feel like family! The food is phenomenal! I didn't think I cared for Indian food but this place is so delicious!!! There isn't one thing on the menu I've had and not fully enjoyed!!! One of the best restaurants in Las Vegas! This is a must try!!! You won't be disappointed!!

Bv1EQgBgZNJ1iY-353dx3w.text: Over priced buffet may be due to location. Went around 11:30am and buffet was missing veg biryani and idli. To me food quality and variety do not justify high buffet cost.

UMrWRfsohyafWbUnw0MEoA.text: A nice, calm & relaxed place off the strip. Definitely worth a visit if you are in Vegas. We were staying in Venetian & were bored of eating Italian food. We tried the lunch buffet here & it had lots of option for Vegetarian & non vegetarian. Food was reasonably priced & tasted good. On another day we tried their Ala crate menu as well & it was also good & well priced. Servers here are extremely friendly & help you out to pick right dishes. Big thumbs up.

KBo5MXPJ_MBgJjEna2SCgg.text: The lovely thing is having Bollywood dances on screen.   The buffet will be your best best bet in Vegas. A bit hard to find. South Indian as well as the"upper" areas. A bit of many different cultural foods. They are tops! I've lived here for 10 years. Dehli is another place to check out. Have an appetite! You'll need it! Ask for extra napkins. Your nose may bit of a problem with the spice. Extra napkins,if you're with comfortable people, blow your nose! It always happen to be my downfall. Anything spicey, though I love the food. Yeah. Run to the bathroom and hoard tissue for the next blast, or tear up.    The spices are what adds flavor.     Try both out. Post your review. Happy buffet time?!

Yaw4zgbJlczj6Bzh0DCUBA.text: After seven weeks of traveling I was happy to rejoin my family in Las Vegas. It made me happy they were more than willing to join me at this Indian Cuisine. And as I suspected,the staff at Gandhi's were more than happy to welcome us.  The family enjoyed all three dishes ordered. Their meals were a delicious harmony of traditional Indian spices. Hand cooked curry ranging from soothing mild to exciting extra spicy. A selection made to appeal to any culture with an open minded appetite. Or any patron with inquisitive taste buds. Simply put, each one of us were very happy with our dining experience .  As Gandhi once said, "Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony."

photos.caption: Photo of Gandhi India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gandhi India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gandhi India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BcDCjaqEkUzQ_gLaAdCM3A.text: Best Indian cuisine I've had so far.    I believe this is the oldest Indian restaurant in town still standing.    We had the biryani goat, regular and bullet naan bread, malai paneer, chicken tikka, and a sweet lassi.  I didn't think there was anything special about the bullet naan. Garlic and regular naan will do.  The sweet lassi was delicious! Not so sweet.  The entrees were delicious! All of them. The chicken tikka is explosive with flavors. Cooked perfectly and not dry. The malai paneer is really good, too. The curry is seasoned perfectly with the right consistency.  The biryani goat was cooked to perfection as well.  The spice was right!   Portions are shareable.   Prices are a little up there, but, trust me, you'll get your money's worth.  It didn't seem to get packed and there's plenty of parking available.    Shout out to the gentleman that helped us on a Sunday evening (didn't catch your name. Sorry) as well as Chrissy for being very attentive and taking care of us.   I will definitely be coming back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Gandhi India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Regular naan bread. Cooked nicely
Photo of Gandhi India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Goat biryani and malai paneer. So good!
Photo of Gandhi India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bullet naan bread

4zAPmoVl1oOmpGKvR0rTmg.text: Remember Mom's commandment: "Thou shalt go to buffet as soon as it is open"! I obeyed and got here 15 minutes after they were open for lunch. Mom rules! And Gandhi Indian rules for great food. Super fresh and still setting up upon arrival. People if you arrive close to closing time expect limited stale selection on the buffet. Sorry.  There were about 16 choices on the buffet line. Tandoori chicken and curry chicken were good. But the vegetarian okra and onions was outstanding. I am southern boy, and never had okra like this. Pic enclosed. Don't know if this is normal, but being early they made special rice and buttered Nan just for me. Am I that important? :)  A tiny bit pricey at $11.95 for the buffet, but worth it.   This place has super high ceilings mad of solid wood, that are a work of art.  Only small downside was horrible Bollywood videos playing on big screen. Just ignore that and enjoy the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Gandhi India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy okra and onions.

4vtxY8jNv8NW96YLX1KREg.text: Crystal was our waitress. And she knew about the flavorings of each dish. I appreciate her knowledge and friendliness. We ordered butter chicken, tandoori chicken, garlic naan, and rice.  My preference is a less sweet butter chicken with a bit more spice, the man who took our order didn't ask how spicy, and we didn't think to ask. But crystal told us they do a 10 scale and if not specified it comes out at about a 3. So next time I'll try a 6... Or the Tikka masala or korma because crystal let us know those won't be as sweet! Naan was delicious the right amount of crispy not too thick just perfect.

bM0zDnGO65HBo5WjVlnPqQ.text: Refreshing changes have an impressive impact.   Tonight I wanted a light early dinner, preference was Indian appetizers. So I ventured to Las Vegas oldest Indian restaurant Gandhi.   What a good choice, a new feel in the air with a warm welcome, seated with water right away the menu was presented. I ran thru the items and explained what I wanted, a light n small delicious meal without any curries or bread or rice.   The owner, immediately, recommended his preference, not on the menu and assured me that it should satisfy my taste buds.   Well, the owner knows what he was talking about. I was presented with a sizzling plate of Mushrooms and Paneer.   Mushrooms, baked, were lightly sprinkled with home-made gram masala n brushed with butter and Paneer thinly sliced slabs  (OMG what a great flavour) was infused with salt n pepper mix and roasted to perfection. I still after three hours have that flavour, surely it will take me back there soon.    It's a super delight to clean out the platter, to its last morsel, n  walk away flavourful full.  I strongly recommend Gandhi Indian Restaurant, a pleasantly revived vision, new culinary team. A must go for serious Indian food lovers. Ask for the owner to get some out of the menu (secret menu) delicaciess

photos.caption: Photo of Gandhi India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Authentic
Photo of Gandhi India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Masala Mushroom n Paneer

OLwFYdS9l_d9A4wTk7H53g.text: The food was delicious. Authentic North Indian flavor and big portions. Our server Krissy was amazing; she was very attentive.

u4Sf0jt0zRjy94UguRVosg.text: Great food, Excellent customer service.  Mr Harkir Dhillon Provide Great customer service.  Order Ladi Kulcha. It's the best.

IqisrAlUWz5EEvoxQ2GCgA.text: I had not been to Gandhi in years, and I am happy to report that the quality of the food has not changed. So delicious! We went for the lunch buffet, and were so pleased. Great deal! The interior has been redone, and the Bollywood movies were so fun. My teenager son and I both loved it. Highly recommend!!!

V78M4YqpndKn-780h9CkSQ.text: Better than winning at the tables. I was on my way to a well known chefs establishment when my taxi driver mentioned Ghandi, I took a chance and changed direction. The chef is a magician, the lamb vindaloo was inspired. The layers of flavor were amazing. The wait staff are considerate and attentive without being in your face. Can a spend a moment on the lamb... Honestly, I have never had better... Get off the strip and have some great food.

bRPHMnnlYwqramLhP3WL7A.text: I have been eating at Gandhi's for 15+ years. Not only is it my favorite Indian cuisine in town, it is my favorite restaurant in town!  My husband and I ate here this evening. He ordered Goat Curry and I had Malai Kofta we ordered Vegetable Biryani and garlic naan to share. We both love spicy foods and ordered an 8 on a scale of 1 to 10. The food came out so fast and it was delicious!!! It actually had heat!  Besides the always great food our server, Crystal, was very sweet. She obviously took pride in her restaurant and took the time to show us the VIP room.   Great work Gandhi's!! I look forward to eating here the next 15 years!

AtXZMsFYEfouej_gXASn1A.text: Typically I'll go pick my food up. Today I decided I would have it delivered. On a scale of 1 to 10, I usually choose a four or five in spiciness. I chose a three. I purchased chicken vindaloo, garlic naan and vegetables samosas.   The garlic naan was greasy. Greasier than anything I've ever seen before. When I opened up the foil, the bread way gray. You could squeeze the oil out with your fingers.  With any Asian dish they give you rice. There was no rice, the order was bland.  I will never go back to this restaurant. There are plenty of places on the West and North side of town that can do a better job than this place.

fYit-nhUiQxTvCW4jGwynQ.text: Must try the tandoori fish, muton as well as their selection of Indian beer.   Great service and hospitality.  Nice alternative to the strip restaurants!

djvnagVrezTKW5heUAhdVg.text: Skip.   Should have known to just stick to Mint or Pure or India Palace.   Items not replenished.  Too salty/spicy.  Quality not there.  Just being honest.

6G906AmV5AZziSRtdMAxXA.text: The best restaurant which offers authentic North Indian food and welcoming hospitality in Vegas. The interior of restaurant reflects Indian culture. We were so much delighted with the food and hospitality that we went there twice a day after another. We had buffet lunch which had so many types of Sabjis such as sag paneer, paneer makhanvala, veg kofta, dal makhani and they had some non vegetarian options also. Manager Mr. Satnamsingh was very attentive towards all customers. The must have is garlic naan.. It was so soft from inside and crunchy from outside and light for stomach. I still can't forget the mouthwatering Gulab jambun.. it melts in your mouth easily. We highly recommend this place for tfor best Indian food in Vegas.

rsync8GmGIXeyLN0Ia_4Wg.text: So we were passing thru Vegas and were craving authentic Indian food but didn't want to deal with all the hype of downtown vegas life just a chill down to earth place this place is the place to go!!! Hands down great food, excellent attentive service and made us feel like family. We order a little bit of everything but the chicken tikka masala is always my fave go to dish and this place definitely did not dissappoint and of course garlic naan we would reccomend this place to anyone so good didn't even take pics of food we ate it so fast lol

6W24x3Xl_mKvdPzkrk3whg.text: 12 of us of went here for dinner & Crystal served us by herself for the most part. We have several in our group who had never had Indian food. zNeQJ1AbsskjSKkgidjdcQ.text: Okay, here is the story. We went here after we saw this restaurant featured in one of the movie. We went there on Monday night for dinner, wasn't crowded. Food was good, but nothing outstanding. Very dark place. Overall, a nice Indian good after some good tired days of walk and fun in Vegas..

CLUon1839HV5Ey4Fd3_orA.text: And the food quality is not good and the price is too high, suggest you go somewhere else and get what your moneys worth... Don't go for the buffet.

Uw7MeQmTZggSoZNa67u2yg.text: Food was amazing very authentic and staff was amazing! Our waitress Christina made it even better. I highly recommend this restaurant if you are looking for something new and unique.

pVIWeOn_gb0JF4IyJwUw0A.text: We came in around 3pm and the place was empty - yay! We had it to ourselves.  We had lamb samosas for the appetizer, then my friend had a goat and spinach dish while I had a vegetable dish. We got naan instead of rice and it was pretty bomb. I enjoyed my friend's dish and she enjoyed mine, so we switched. Hers was creamy and the goat was very flavorful. Mine was a "farmers" dish with a sweet and spicy orange sauce. They were both delicious and mood-elevating.  The wait time for the food was very short and we watched Bollywood music videos in the meantime, which were fun and colorful.  We got a couple of mango lassis alongside the meal and finished with pistachio dessert. Everything tasted amazing.  The waitress was very nice and comped the dessert for us, which my struggling student's budget appreciated.  We'll definitely come again, it was worth the money.

3LMu0y2Uc8hzYIjQnwGzJg.text: Very good authentic Indian food and great service . We were in Vegas for a convention and stopped here for dinner. It's. Must do Indian restaurant ... When in Vegas .

E06NulPc2FcOBCaP770dqw.text: Gandhi is awesome. Please don't take my word for it, go try their fish tikka and fish pakora and I bet you you'll fall in love with it. This comes from a foodie who loves authentic fish!

kuXix8Hk7DnCdHhHMrITIg.text: Awesome Food. Great Service. Definitely would recommend for Authentic Indian food in a classy style

fdPom_QigoHY6uh-NCTQrA.text: I love their food but...service is sometimes lacking.    Went last week to the lunch buffet, as soon as we sat down they asked what type of naan we wanted and had it to us almost before we finished getting our first plate from the buffet line. They even made us a dish that wasn't on the buffet line.  Only issue I had was that we had to refill our own water.  Went again today and I don't know what it was but maybe the boss wasn't around.  After sitting down with our first plate and finishing about half of it we finally had to ask if we were getting any naan and to do that we had to interrupt the waiters cell conversation.  When the naan came five minutes later it was somewhat burnt which I don't really care about but the person I was with didn't really care for.   We arrive well before the end of the lunch buffet but shortly after we sat down they started prepping the other tables for dinner, kind of made it feel like there was a rush for us to finish.  Again we had to get our own water refills.  To top it off, after we were most of the way done with our lunch we were told that they couldn't take cards today, cash only, I had to dig around to find enough to cover it, would have been nice if we were told that before we started.

f_Dx8F6SBITXnTkfW2fsrA.text: Came here on a Friday night. We walked in and it was pretty quiet. MP, the host, greeted us with a smile and sat us at a booth. He explained the menu and since I'm vegetarian he offered some good recommendations. Our appetizer came out rather quickly.  I had the ghandi tali. Everything on the tray was delicious. There was enough food on the tray for two people. Crystal our server came over several times to check on us, also very friendly. The thali also came with desserts. We tried the rice pudding and mango ice cream. Both good choices. Can't wait to come back and try the lunch buffet. We highly recommend this place if you're looking for authentic Indian food off of the Las Vegas strip. Be sure to check in on Yelp for a 10% off

Z9tw6jKFt1waqTNqXS8uYQ.text: Tonight I went with my family to Gandhi for Indian food that was excellent  experience because what we order was so tasty and outstanding. Paneer tikka, tandoori chicken, dal makhni was so tasty and paneer tikka masala was mouth watering. Gandhi naan are always best one In whole vegas. Gandhi food  is excellent food and it remind me of India food .Gandhi staff was good in service and the owner was very friendly. Crystal and Paul was very friendly and helpful for everything. My daughter loved paneer tikka because it's made as per her choice taste. I would love to   recommend my friends  to visit Gandhi Cuisine food when they come to Vegas . I LOVE GANDHI CUISINE FOOD.

Xnk2aBaMSZVDeIR7_N7a_A.text: So I don't write that many reviews, mostly because I'm rarely moved enough to do so. I will say that my experience with Ghandi Indian Cuisine did not begin entirely positively. I was looking though an online menu, found something I wanted, called in to pick it up - only to find that they weren't willing to pack up the dish I had requested. However, very much in the mood for Indian, I decided I would go down there and dine in anyway.  That was where the negativity ended. When I arrived at the restaurant, Ladi the owner greeted me personally, clearly grateful that I had made the choice to come in.  He remembered what I was trying to order early, and after having a server show me to a booth he came over and took my order personally, and made sure I was comfortable. At this point I had forgotten my earlier disappointment and was enjoying the atmosphere and background hum of upbeat Indian music videos.  I ordered the Ghandi Thali, which is like a sample tray of sorts, with Samosas, Aloo Gobi, Malai Kofta, a Paneer dish and Dahl with naan bread and rice. PLENTY of food.  Standout dish for me was the Aloo Gobi. Had a bit of a kick so you may want to request mild if spice is not your thing, but the flavor was excellent. The malai kofta sauce was a highlight as well. The naan was some of the best I've tasted.  If I were to provide some constructive criticism, I would suggest a revisit of the online menu and removing dishes that are not conducive to pickup or delivery, or at least letting people know that some are dine-in only dishes.  At the end of the day: delicious food, passionate and hands-on ownership, very friendly service and a willingness to go the extra mile to turn customers negative experience into a positive one is what earns my 5 stars.  Bravo Gandhi Indian Cuisine!

Yfipa6ewYGlEcRAeojSsCQ.text: Run down restaurant with okay food but exceptionally ride management and staff, won't be returning here and can't recommend this place to anyone anymore.

CY_fW7JqnaIcUJ3xG8huQA.text: Dinner buffet is delicious and affordable. The food, oh man, it's good. Real good. It's pretty busy as well, which speaks for how good the food is. Nice selection in the buffet.

yxFFbbKw7twXbZbg9Nk-Fg.text: Awesome lunch buffet and even better hospitality. Very warm and friendly staff who went out of their way to make us comfortable especially since we were traveling with 2 one year old babies. Will definitely stop there again when in Vegas

TpfRyyETP_O0daLFO_DYug.text: Buffet had very limited options and the price was sky high.. surely the most expensive buffet that I have come across in US in the past 5 years !!! 20 dollars for a buffet with the options they had was absolutely not worth it. If you are looking at value for money, this is NOT the place.

67AFs8SlkaLHf2Mm-CzKgw.text: I went to have dinner here the other night with my mom and we both absolutely loved the food! We were seated immediately and our waiter was very friendly and took great care of us! The atmosphere is so warm and welcoming! We ordered our food and it didn't take long at all. The food was so delicious we ate every morsel of it! It's flavored perfectly with spices and the aroma of it leaves your mouth watering! I would definitely recommend trying the garlic naan, butter chicken, malai kofta, and pista kulfi! Those are just some of my personal favorites but everything else I have tried is just as good! The staff is absolutely wonderful! Every time a waiter walked by, even if he wasn't ours, we were asked if we were enjoying our food and if we needed anything else. I will definitely be going back soon!

bv_mkjhATl6XuHweeV_yxw.text: The food here is amazing! The tikka masala is the best I've ever had. Highly recommend

8ThrYV3_YQeypVoEnfMejg.text: Excellent food, the owner met us personally and even busted our table! Great atmosphere as well

qBFXCzcfej9tYlAs1rTLWA.text: The buffet is ok here.  I actually enjoyed dinner much more.  I got one of the tandoori sets which was pretty good.  I'd rather go to other places for an Indian lunch buffet.  But the atmosphere is kinda "eh" here compared to some of the other places around which is why this wouldn't be my first choice.

18b8bBrhjYV077J5SUH8pg.text: Food: 3  Service: 3  Had the Gandhi Thali -- a sampler of vegetarian items. The malai kofta was tasty, but the mattar Paneer was blah and had only one small chunk of cheese. The samosa had a tender crust. For dinner, it would be better to go with a group so you can choose the things to share.   Service was OK but unexceptional. I'd like to go back for lunch to try their buffet.

iFfpA8100SxeHMF40nZ5rQ.text: Hmmm... I can't believe that other yelpers didn't like Gandhi, as I have had only excellent dining experiences there.  I've never tried the buffet, and have been wanting to... but maybe I won't now after what you guys said about it.  I'm also vegetarian, so if their meat is horrible, I have no idea about that.    I have had the Narvatan Korma twice (excellent) and the Aloo Palak (yum!  You can tell it's full of butter...but who cares it's so good).  The first 2 times I was there they brought pappadoms as an appetizer; I was a little disappointed when they didn't on my last visit.  Not usually crowded unless you're there at peak dinner time on weekends.  The room is kind of cavernous, I wouldn't want to sit right in the middle surrounded by tables of people.  Try to get one of the super comfy booths around the outside.     Waiters are nice and super cute!

9taEbJ18t8TG2kD4YTs2Zw.text: Alright, this is another place that you have to know how to do right.  I have been here for lunch and dinner, and lunch is totally the way to go.  They have a really tasty Indian buffet with lots of options.  I am not sure which ones are gluten-free, so the next time I go back to Vegas, I'll have more to report.  The service is alright.  I usually go thirsty for water.  Remember, your lassi is not included in the buffet price.  They do have large bus tours of people who come here en masse, so rub your rabbit's foot to make sure you don't show up at the same time.  Dinner is table service, which isn't the most awesome, and provides less value than the buffet.  Great vegetarian selections.  (Again, will update this again with GF facts.)  The best value for Indian food in Vegas.

tNmj_-gFKu8zymKEaEYJ8Q.text: Excellent! Nice clean place, good style for interiour and the sweetest very PATIENT waiters. Most importantly, the food was great! Appetizers like North indian thali and South indian thali was a good variety and lots of it.. Great taste og both chicken and lamb.. "Best lamb I've ever eaten!" Was what my husband said, and he always said he didn't like lamb that much... Their kebab is the best! For dessert we can say the Kulfi Mango (icecream) was the favorite at our table.  We were 4 people having dinner, only $125 which we think is very fair price for good food and we were stuffed!:) The have a beer called "something" 5000 a nice pilsner, delicious. A lot of locals were there too; always a good sign.  We will be back soon and try the lunch buffet:)

cpmaYJ2OvR8tRq8OaX3R6Q.text: Rrally awesome food. Malai paneer was excellent and butter naan was too good. Even lassi was great too.

fN54yBduCSFDECUAvfzHrg.text: A hole-in-the-wall place.  Indian owned.  I like how when you walk in you feel like you are in a real indian restaurant, complete with a Hindu Elephant God statue there.  There were lots of indian customers eating there.    Food is ok, ~$12 bucks lunch buffet.  Def get the 15% off coupon from hotel magazines.  I don't really know my indian food, so hard to judge it's authenticity.  Not the best I've had, but def edible.  Naan bread, salad, tandori chicken, & sauces were good.  Skip on the curry.

AL1Pn7umViYjFCPjRSf2MA.text: Located in a weird angled funky strip I came here to satisfy my Indian Food binge.  This restaurant is large and looks as if it hosts banquets and members of the community.    I have only had Indian at one other restaurant. Gandhi  does offer a wide variety of dishes. There are over 10 vegetarian entrees.  There are some nans and  baked breads I have never seen before and I love the breads.  My friend had Tandoori prawns which even in San Francisco I don't see at all.    There are a few dishes I will order next time just for the sheer fact I can't find these dishes at home.

k3mk4C9mUvkW6eoyi3jcXQ.text: The place is loc in the middle of a shady strip mall.  We got there and it LOOKS elegant from the inside, but dont be fooled.  The waiter took forever to take our order and took forever to bring us our food, - so Poor service.  The food was so bland and non tasty.  I ordered the meat Thali and it wasnt good at all.  Might as well have starved.  and on top of that it was crazy expensive.  like 15-18 dollar per plate.  I dont wanna pay that much and get nothing back in return.  Im Indian - take it from me - this place SUCKS.

6YFesMAR6XweuBIVcebffg.text: Gandhi- a fresh relaxing place to go enjoy the best indian food in Vegas.         I go to Gandhi every week for the chicken tikka masala and it is the best I have tried anywhere, and I have had this dish in London, Orlando, and many places around the U.S.      I haven't been to India, but can guess and say that this is authentic indian cuisine made by friendly accomodating people. They are all very nice and the restaurant has indian music that adds to the experience. It is nice decor and I highly recommend it to anyone looking to experience this. Going here is an experience, not just a meal in my opinion.       There are foods here that are spicy and different than many things I have tried, but once you know what the dishes are (I didn't know what many were until I went here and tried the great lunch buffet,) but once I tasted them I expanded my food choices a bit.       One of the keys to enjoying a restaurant like this that may be different food than the usual burgers and fries many americans are used to, is that you have to sample different stuff to see what you like. If you dont like hot or spicy food, they will make dishes mild for you.All you have to do is ask. My fav is the tikka masala, and garlic nan with basmati rice.      Try this place-great flavorful food,  cool people, good music and  nice decor and ambiance. -from a regular weekly customer

7gQCpcGJ-qYG1pOYKSRvXg.text: I love their take out buffet... Delicious and reasonable food and has variety of food in the buffet.. Feel at home when you are in Vegas .....

nLO-ChwHosg3WO3TevkUGA.text: Food here is really good as well as service too. I do recommend to visit this place when you are at vegas

qfqU7C0jV76nyCimbD9_pg.text: Ohhh myyy agahhh.   Ghandi has this lunch buffet that you cannot beat. Sometimes I daydream about the food the next day (that's not normal for me). Sometimes I will think about who would be willing to go with me for Sunday lunch. I can assure you that EVERY single person I have ever introduced to Indian food by taking them here has begged me to go back immediately. If you've never had indian food, its the perfect place to start because you can pick and choose. It's addicting and you can't really beat the price for a buffet of about $12 per person. The food is so flavorfuls and there is always a ton of variety to choose from.   The outside is nothing to write home about, located in a sketchy parking lot area but inside its like a beautiful indian palace of deliciousness. The service is nice. Like the cashier makes jokes sometimes that I don't immediately understand, but then eventually I do.

RN5IyqwrAQQUCdbQM3kJlA.text: Best food I've had in Vegas so far. My boyfriend and I loved everything we had. I'm a vegetarian he's not. Our service was a bit spotty; we had to wait a good 15 minutes for our bill, and I never got the dessert that came with my meal after ordering it. I would rate this 5/5 if our service had been better. We beat the dinner rush thankfully. When we walked in there were only ten other customers; when we walked out, that number had at least tripled. The ambiance was intimate and the restroom was one of the cleanest I've seen in this city.

photos.caption: Photo of Gandhi India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetarian combo #2

vT1-g8jw9Ipaj3ipWWbfbA.text: We've been going here for years and today was very likely the last time, sad to say. The parking lot was surprisingly empty and I guess we now know why. My wife normally loves the tandori chicken but today it was EXTREMELY dry and unedible. We told our waiter about it and he takes the piece of dry chicken from our table and takes it to the back kitchen and seemed to tell the cook that the chicken was bad. Well, no follow up, no apology and he seemed to laugh it off with the female waitress that seemed to be flipping the dry pieces, just picking at them. I've kind of noticed the food was getting lower in quality lately, but didn't say much since it was my wife's favorite Indian lunch buffet. Even the solidly prepared mango lassi was full of ice pieces, didn't taste good and didn't arrive to the table until my plate was nearly finished. I didn't even go for seconds, since there really wasn't anything worth going back for. We have other choices for Indian food and next time it won't be here. Maybe they changed owners?

The place is not kept well, the water jugs look like they haven't been washed forever, the 'silverware' is cheap plastic coated to look like silver, and the food is pathetic. I am already beginning to feel my tummy grumble. Our server had a friendly face and was polite and courteous. That's what stops me from giving this place one star but that's not reason enough to eat here again.  I see a lot of 5* reviews about the food so I was forced to think what I missed. Probably the chef or something else has changed, but as it stands now, this is a no-go.

hgfkmejG03n8AhVP44qsgA.text: The food here is amazing!  I love Indian food and I eat it whenever I can. This place is the best!  And Crystal (probably mispelled) is super friendly, super efficient and knowledgeable.  Ask for her!

tczAcDSHK3kAz4aXdkv5pg.text: This place is solid! We usually come for the lunch buffet because it's close to UNLV, but have recently tried the dinner menu and it was very yummy with a lot of options.   We've eaten here many times and always have received great service!

VcWw5AJnFHw7WCqBLEdfjA.text: Vegas is the land of the strip mall.  Seriously, outside of downtown, they're everywhere, and wedged in between all the nail salons and paycheck-advance stores, you can find some pretty good restaurants, if you don't mind the less-than-breathtaking surroundings.  Gandhi is a solid, reliable Indian restaurant that we've been going to for years.  The building is mysteriously huge, with super-high ceilings and a dining area that goes on for miles, but it does fill up at peak times on the weekends.  The decor is nothing fancy - bare white walls livened up with some wall hangings or framed pictures - but you're not there for the ambience, you're there for tons of spicy food.  When you sit down, they'll plop some pappadom down in front of you (those crunchy cracker-like flatbreads), plus a mint-cilantro sauce and a sweet-and-sour sauce.  I love this stuff, but be judicious in your use of the spicy sauce, because water service can be a bit slow here.  Everything here is good, especially the garlic naan.  The tandoori chicken is yummy, as is the rogan josh, palak paneer, and tikka masala.  Entrees range from $10--12, although they also have special tasting menus (including salad, rice, and dessert) that range from $15--22.  They have a lunch buffet on weekdays that's also an excellent value.  And there's a pretty good selection of beer and wine, including a few Indian beers, to go with your meal.  Nothing fancy decor- or ambience-wise, Gandhi nevertheless delivers good and reasonably priced Indian food in a quiet and pleasant setting.  If Vegas isn't already hot enough for you, spice it up with a trip to Gandhi.  And get the garlic naan!

6CJCrHOmxJohzQmzsIFq3w.text: The food was OK at best. We want on Monday in the after-noon and it looks like they were serving food left over from the past weekend.

s235fwRXgBH-nT0BSZ6Qqg.text: My Indian friend recommended this place. Unfortunately, everything I ate there didn't taste good. I had one dish that had this orange sauce with so much cream in it that it made me nauseous. Also, their garlic nan bread was terrible. It was so thick, bready and dry with thick chunks of which tasted like uncooked garlic. I took one bite and tossed them all out. Why is it so hard to find good, flaky nan in the Vegas area??!! The worst thing was that it was ridiculously expensive for two things and nan it was $40. Outrageous! I did get a discount that dropped the priced to $30 something but still it definitely was not worth it.

lgkjCkHqUzGyI9Y33uRBvw.text: Having just got off the plane from LA and having not eaten for several hours, I was on the verge of passing out.  (Not really, but I was feeling pretty peckish.)  Jeff and I were driving towards the hotel, when I spotted Gandhi out of the corner of my eye.  Knowing that he likes India, having lived there for over a year, I thought he might like to try.  I am always willing to try a new Indian place.    I got a combination plate that had chicken tikka, some marinated chicken, kafta chopped up and a grilled shrimp.  The plate also came with some lentils, rice, raita, lettuce,paneer in a curry sauce and a curry with shrimp in it.    Jeff got a vegetarian plate that had the same rice, raita and lentils, but he also got a cauliflower dish (I don't remember the name) and some other curried vegetable.  He ate it all, so I know he liked it, but I don't think he loved it.    I loved pretty much everything I got, except the lentils. They needed something.  Salt?  The paneer was delicious.  It reminded me of the fresh cheese my grandmother used to make.  The shrimp curry was delicious, just the right amount of heat to it.  The raita was tasty.  The rice was nothing special.  I liked the naan.  I ate several pieces and I don't normally do that.    Jeff ordered a mango lassi.  He asked that they make it special with no milk, just yogurt.  They did that and he loved it.  He might have ordered another, if he weren't so full.    The service started off really well, but then it went downhill from there.  We got the food and then we never saw the waiters again. They were busy serving others.  So, we waited forever for the bill and a box to take home the leftovers.    The decor was kinda nice, kinda funky, kinda dark and kinda fashionable.  I liked certain parts of the restaurant, like the giant wooden Ganesh near the entrance.  The red on the walls was nice.  The paintings weren't anything special.  They turned up the lights for us, so we could read the menu. There were some special rooms that could be shut off with curtains.  I liked that touch.   I would definitely go back.  I wonder what the buffet would have been like, since we were there for dinner.

8qWEQQ1aZuSPwIi1CXmWsg.text: Love this place, just wish I could afford to eat here more. Its not too pricey, its just a wee bit above my budget. They should have more specials maybe a coupon. Best chai I've ever had and the vegintarian menu is huge. Absolutely love it!

cDLc9OR0sY04RwBJborW2g.text: wow. such an upgrade since i used to spend countless lunch buffets with coworkers, back in the day when i used to work in the howard hughs pkway offices... i took my wife there for lunch just last week.  the GRUB: - chutneys and sauces galore - plenty of your veggie favorites: stewed chick peas, saag paneer (spinach with cheese), curry potatoes and peas, fried onion dumplings, and other dishes - all delicious - meat too - tandori grilled chicken, chicken tikka, butter chicken, etc. - got bread and carbs? basatmi rice, naan, rice cakes, spicy noodle dish, samosas... all good. - dessert: mango custard with fruit, fried brown sugar pastries in a sugary syrup sauce, and fresh fruit - yummy. - hot tea, coffee, mango lassi, sodas and juices available.  the JOINT: - such a turn around from when i used to frequent years back... the white table clothes have been replaced by all wood tables covered by fancy black linens... the open balcony now houses private dining areas perfect for parties that want an intimate booth... even the buffet section is granite counter tops with built in buffets - fancy. much fancier than the old tables with the buffet heat trays... - indian decor - many intricate paintings and woodwork abound, including a huge wooden hand carved goddess at the entry... floor to ceiling curtains and fabrics of india surround you. very nice. - plenty of seating - clean and upscale (especially for a buffet)  the SQUEEZE: - friendly and attentive service as always. - about $25 per person for lunch - a little pricey. - cash and card accepted  the FINAL SAY: my wife and i enjoyed our lunch buffet, and it kept us full for most of the day... and for me, it was such a pleasant surprise to see that the owner has done so much to upgrade on such a great indain buffet restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Gandhi India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Indian buffet.

BxVUhvR0BUaDDfKDVizhIw.text: Not worth the hype .. Went there after seeing yelp reviews ... The idly sambar was the worst ! The malai kofta was good .. The rice was not cooked. Not sure if this is the case only today .. Unfortunately it was not a good experience for us

WDIGQmpzcDhX7PgUXO2CZg.text: Gandhi was recently shut down for a multi-generational cockroach infestation.   If you feed them, they will come. And these roaches had a feast.   Inspectors called the infestation "excessively active" and found the roaches housed inside an excessively greasy burner where food was actively cooking. Roaches were also in the prep area, near the sink and on the hot line.   Gandhi's own pest control reports showed the restaurant requires a complete clean-out to eliminate the roach problem.   We went by to see if any cleaning was going on.Their van was parked outside, but the restaurant's doors were locked.   The sign on the door says they're closed for remodeling, indicating someone should be doing something.  In addition to the roach infestation, inspectors also saw a food handler using expired, 11-day old tomato sauce to cook with.

ht19-fG3oRBfnLCifo1Ayg.text: Worst indian buffet i have ever had. I had veg none of the dishes are good. Pakora was very hard. Sambar and idly horrible. ZqndPAX6NUrJsETaMAvWzA.text: We came here on a family recommendation and we gave the place two separate tries; once for the lunch buffet and once for dinner, neither was particularly great.   Over all the ambiance was beautiful and the service was great, but if that were all it took to make a great restaurant we wouldn't be reading yelp reviews. KNglvi6IU6NwLuDEE17N_Q.text: The food here is Delicious, I'm usually not the one to write reviews but after ages I had such good kebabs that I am now compelled to write a review. He offered us a sample of kheer (rice pudding) on the house because he just wanted us to try his favorite desert. Will definitely be bringing my friends here.

JjHkn97kbjDDXZS6fRuDxA.text: We ordered biryani with a medium spice level. It was extremely hot and we were not able to eat it. Also we ended up paying 20$ for it. Not worth the price.

JPWCGTjxy56b0Q4sZEtkbA.text: Whenever my husband and I come to Vegas, we always eat solely at Las Vegas's best kept secret: Gandhi India's Cuisine.  We've tried other Indian restaurants in Vegas and thought they were just okay.  Gandhi is a cut above.  Everything is so masterfully flavorful, your mouth does a little dance with each bite!  Last time we were there, I discovered the eggplant bhartha which was amazing, also, there's a mushroom dish on the menu that was out of this world--and I'm not even a mushroom lover, I barely even like them!  But the sauce was so yummy and delicious.  The samosas are some of the best we've tasted.  Mango lassi and kulfi are excellent.  Please maintain your reputation by hiring and keeping the best cooks ever.    Also on a side note: please make sure you keep your salt level just right.  I don't eat out much, so sodium can be an issue for me at some Indian restaurants.  The spices, onions, tomatoes, etc., give the perfect taste, not so much salt is needed.  So when in doubt, use a pinch less.

7DssL4-KVOYMRfAmfByllw.text: The dinner buffet had a variety of options for vegetarian and non-vegetarian. The food was good but some dishes could have been better. The Chai was my favorite part. Definitely will recommend to others who are visiting Vegas.

I absolutely love Indian and this restaurant has effectively made me a customer for life. I will definitely throw in a visit every time I find myself in Vegas

3Xuwo74FepwCRQzWf7GM-g.text: Delightful lunch buffet with many options. Don't let the plain exterior fool you; the interior is gorgeous with high ceilings, mood lighting and lovely colors. Naan is delivered to the table; choices on the table the day we visited included many sauces, many vegetarian dishes, oranges, pakora (yum!), two options that included paneer, and three different chicken options. I thought it was delicious and appreciated the variety of flavors.

04fakGOohgv-2Wd7wrCh9A.text: Truly disappointing lunch buffet. I've been to Gandhi a few times and its been pretty good. This is the first time I tried the lunch buffet and, the fact that I felt compelled to leave a review, should be an indicator of how I felt my meal went. First of all, no one at the front when I came in, i came in and looked at the buffet line and then waited for roughly 2-3 minutes to even see an employee, they finally sat me and I got my first round of food. The tandoori chicken was nearly cold and hard as a rock, the side that was on the chafing dish was charred to a crisp (not always a bad thing). I informed the young waiter that the tandoori chicken was cold, he went and took the temperature of the chicken, said something to his, what looked to be his boss, then closed the lid. Clearly it was under temperature and he tried to reheat it in this way... huge health hazard that could get them closed in of itself. No biryani, only 3 meat dishes and all were chicken, no naan or rice on the buffet line so it had to be brought out which seemed to be difficult to even find someone to help. My drink remained empty for the majority of my meal even though a waiter kept walking by. I finally asked for a refill and it took him about 8 minutes to bring me my refill. Sweet rice for dessert? what the hell is that? Literally their basmati rice that they serve to everyone, mixed with milk and sugar. It was disgusting and the rice was under cooked. I'm Indian... I have never heard of this recipe before.... for 11.95... its a rip off. Enjoy GOOD indian food and drive a block up to Delhi Indian Cuisine.

lP7LI4kwknTHGRTmfvH40g.text: Food was great. Server had very bad attitude. If you don't like doing customer service. Find another job!

24LBGjN6-KDMBBSa3LRrHQ.text: Why does this place only have three and a half stars? It should be five! This place is kind of hidden behind a corner building. You wouldn't expect much based from the outside, but man it has nice wooden ceilings, comfortable, roomy chairs, spacious walk ways, and a chill ambience!   The inside is cozy, variety of booths, tables, and extra large booths. They even have an upstairs level. The place is clean, it smelled amazing and the floors, tables, chairs, and utensils were neatly polished. Staff is very friendly and attentive. Your drinks and dirty plates get refilled and taken away without you even noticing. The food taste and smells absolutely yunmy. There's great variety from vegan to some chicken and the naan is sooo soft and soooooooooo good!   It's perfect for a quick lunch with friends, perfect for a group lunch with your coworkers, perfect for a dinner date with your babe, and perfect for your family. I like how they offer a 10% discount on yelp AND a 10% DISCOUNT for STUDENTS. It's reasonably priced to begin with, considering it's near the strip, even without a discount. For a party of two with a 10% discount, our bill ended up to be $23 plus tip.  This place is an absolute YASSSS! Must try right now. I'd go back any time any day with anyone. Eat here

photos.caption: Photo of Gandhi India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken curry loveeee

Photo of Gandhi India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So much good on a plate

xlPygHPd9kcUkW0VEGPX1w.text: Looking for good Indian restaurant in Las Vegas .we finally found "THE ONE".  Everything about "Gandhi" is good (maybe location is a little farther than I would like)..  Decor: rich dark colors, very spacious rooms. Food: EXCELLENT! That's another big STAR to Gandhi restaurant. Every our request was accommodated. They try to make your buffet a real "experience". Which gives a great feeling of being taken care of.  Naan. Excellent. Another item we ordered more for take out, we enjoyed later.  Prices: Surprisingly inexpensive.  Overall great restaurant. If you get a chance stop here and you won't regret it.

gEmyF46JIqKkm02eCWQNCQ.text: We went two times there for buffet. Our first visit was horrible experince, their staff is not so courteous and friendly. When it comes to food, it is average not so good. That day their staff was in hurry to kick us out without letting us to finish our food. Never be treated like that. We decided not to come to this place ever.   But because of our friend's food desperation and also went through with two other indian resturants(seeing long waiting lines), we have ended up here again during xmas2017 visit. Our bigest mistake was we did not ask the buffet price, thinking it will be normal charges ranging min $12 to max. $15.  Food was very good on that day specially bhindi masala/okra curry was tested freshly made eventhough we arrived at 1:00pm. May be they were out of other curry and replaced with this. Anyway most of buffet dishes veg. and non veg. were very tasty except naan as usual buffet naan never taste good in most of places but that was ok for us. Incident happen when my husband was eating his samosa with green chutney and he found green wire in green chutney(one we use to close plastic bags in store), we informed to waiter and he said ok ok i will let kitchen staff know, nothing else. Thinking that how horribly they manage and care in the kitchen. Although overall food was great, so we neglected that incident, and also their service. but when they charged us $20 per person for our buffet plus added gratuity where service was zero, we were stunned (unethical business behavior).  Request to owner  * Please keep eyes on your staff how they treat your customers, our both experience were horrible. * Courteous behavior in food industry is very much needed.  * Make place little bit spacious so other people's chair don't stuck on the way when we go to serve ourselves from buffet * In second trip, buffet was ridiculously overpriced, please don't change the price in order to take advantage of holiday season. Its not ethical. * being generous, gave one star is only for the chef who work hard in the kitchen o/w youguys don't deserve even one star...

JaqUtmBUwA5pSOen-gGz3w.text: It's was great food , i had paneer tikka , salted lassi ,chicken tikka masala , Garlic nann,in desert Mango kulfi , great costumer service its first Indian resturent in lasvegas , a lot celebrities viste there its my favorite Indian resturent in lasvegas

u3rBE-oOcj_cTCBPW8arNw.text: This is a hidden jewel tucked away in a little strip mall about 10 min from the strip.  I was alone and interested in a combination plate.   I found one with an appetizer that looked like a main entree for two!   It was a delicious combination of grilled sausages, shrimp, tandoori chicken...it was fantastic.   The rest of the meal was equally as delicious.  And ended with a frozen mango dessert that was very simple but incredible.     I took half my meal home for tomorrow yet I'm stuffed!  The restaurants Decor is beautiful with many private dining cubbies for larger groups (of 6 plus)  The service was excellent and helpful and clearly commited to giving me a good experience.  I'm glad my yearning for an Indian experience pulled me away from the strip.  I located this place via Yelp and even discovered a small Yelp coupon (never seen one of those before)

photos.caption: Photo of Gandhi India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very simple but stunningly delicious frozen mango dessert
Photo of Gandhi India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This appetizer could have been a full entree for two.   grilled sausage, chicken shrimp and tandoori chicken

9S6OEVrsth2jEIngzQK9Yg.text: Tasty food and good ambience and welcoming host. Liked the veggie pakoras and baingan bharta

9n2KWpFVnL4h66a_UhYDaA.text: Best Indian food in town + the setting / decoration of this place is stylish n modern ! Luv it :)

Ms5kNkkkcw01TX4P1XqCtQ.text: The food was TERRIFIC! Soooooo, good, I could eat their Nan for the rest of my life. I will definitely go back!  The parking however, is sketchy and I  was quite concerned leaving my car outside.

EO63LvwiKingG2vqWydPXg.text: A few people from my office regularly patronize this location for lunch, so today I came in to give it a shot. I would have NEVER known this place existed if I didn't work near by because it's hidden in a really run down looking plaza just next to Morton's, but inside it has an awesome hip ambiance, low lighting and swanky Indian music!! I left full and happy! I will be back again for the lunch buffet. I can't handle a lot of heat in my food and to me, this was PERFECT, not too spicy and not bland either, lot's of flavor. I LOVED the fresh baked naan bread (I got plain). I have been to another Indian place in the area that gets higher stars on Yelp and I personally like this place way better! During my visit I noticed a lot of Indian patrons eating as well, I take that as a good sign. I totally recommend.

4A2dxKY7YIV1JnJWuFlKuA.text: Best Indian in Vegas - hands down. I grew up in Vegas but I live in Philly now (EKTA!)  and I've been around the world many times since. The vegetable pakora at Ghandi is still the best I've ever had and I always make sure to eat here when I'm in town.

o_5X0jnwPSJ1aq9krMjGMA.text: Very helpful! Amazing people... We were late they still let us in gave us what we asked for, and las but not the least called the cab for us which was late and they let us stand inside till the cab arrived. Unbelievably amazing food! The butter chicken is flawless... Perfect for people who like a little spice, but they make it without spice if you want them to. Literally Flawless.

hfdjcI3q40Aom6lklVYbag.text: Absolutely delicious. You won't be sorry if you go. But you will be sorry when your friends tell you how delicious it is and you don't go. Plus Crystal, one of the servers is amazing.

8SHe5KST2pJU13loUS7ZXQ.text: We had the buffet here last week, sambhar was very spicy, chole was swimming in oil and wasn't great either. Pakodas were really soft and looked like malnourished children from Somalia. Normally in  a buffet you have at least 3 veggie curry options 2 eat curry options, 2 appetizers. This one only has 2 veggie curry options, 1 appetizer. I had dined here 10 years ago and food was pretty decent, not sure what happened now..

YJ7nIsOH8S_GFa04nSucYA.text: Very attentive staff. Delicious food and great ambience. The mango kulfi was delicious. Will definitely come back next time I'm in town

joyC6WkiyZBf7epnecc-wQ.text: Fantastic, fantastic Indian food. The malai kofta and chicken tikka masala are delicious and the naan is PERFECT. Dunno why this place only has 3.5 stars...

2iU7iNA_Xi1PTODnU5Sl7Q.text: The service was very poor, the atmosphere very average. Food was good, even though we were not ask if we wanted our food mild so our food was hot flavored. Price was ok till u realize that all food is a la carte. I did not realize rice was extra with your curry, so be sure to get your side otherwise you will disappointed. Overall, I will not come here.

c1utMA2N-hjoJqQnTy96dA.text: Amazing food. When I come to Vegas I always eat at Ghandis.  Most authentic wonderful Indian food and very close to the Strip

pTwiHYMerDYMLQ_P_c2zyw.text: This restaurant is a hidden gem. First let me say - I'm a local and live close to the strip but I don't really like going to the casinos for a nice dinner. I'm used to fine dining and like a great ambience. I came across a flyer for this restaurant in the highrise where I live, so I thought I would check it out. The food was delicious, the staff was incredible and the restaurant had a nice traditional decor. From the outside you wouldn't think it was anything special but I HIGHLY encourage you to step inside and enjoy a delightful dinner! If you're visiting Vegas, it's close to the Strip and reasonably priced. If your local, this is a great local spot where the staff will treat you like family.  I'll definitely be back. And the Mango Lassi is a must! It's unbelievably delicious.

UxDgcB1A5Ls-9nT7pJUQUw.text: I came here. Went home. And cried to my mom why i wasnt indian. For real tho, SO GOOD. best ik ndian food ive ever had. Nothing ive tried even compares. Love this place!!

F3NZHTeIG2SE51kCCL22CA.text: Excellent food & service :) Some of us ordered meat thali and others veggi thali - and we were stuffed and very pleased. The taste and spice level was perfect. The experience was topped with excellent service - our water kept being refilled, the owner Laddi was very friendly and welcoming. Definitely going back when we visit Vegas again!

S18AzrGGOSNeLGtB_Mcduw.text: 1st time trying India food while on vacation. Food was good but the service was outstanding!  Courteous and attentative!

zoE5L2WpjE6sJ3RjSXrDbw.text: Whenever I visit Vegas, i make sure to stop by Gandhi! the food here is delicious and the service is as amazing. They offer a balanced menu of both vegetarian and non vegetarian dishes, both of which are to die for. my favorite would have to be the butter chicken and naan. The lamb chops as appetizers are delicious as well.   Food aside, I definitely want to point out their excellent service and decor. the waiters are attentive and cater to all your needs. The decor is very ancient india inspired with a touch of modernity. . I would definitely say the look is quiet upscale and the prices are affordable. If you want authentic indian cuisine and a comfortable setting then look no further. Gandhi is the place for you.

vkDC39rvQ1IpU43CNvTa5A.text: Came across this place when I visited Las Vegas just before Christmas and wanted to find a place to have Indian food. Ordered a Chicken Biryani carryout order since dinner buffet was almost on the verge of completion. Let me explain here - I am a food lover and can instantly say by the look of Indian restaurants on what kind of food to expect. There are different versions of "authentic" indian cuisines floating around and I must say this is not one of them. Biryani was sweet (authentic biryani is NEVER sweet) with cashew and raisins.  Good luck with this place.

kyRxwDosENwqPuaQkNBl3A.text: I wasn't looking for Indian food, I was looking for CVS, so I could get some Excedrin for my headache.  But I turned into the wrong stripmall, and passed Gandhi.  No, not that Gandhi, he's dead.  Gandhi the restaurant.  What caught my attention were the people.  Dozens of Indian people headed into the restaurant.  Hmm.  "Best of Las Vegas" proclaimed the banner.  In this place?  What the heck, my last Vegas review was Fatburger, let's diversify a bit.  The restaurant itself is well appointed, clean, comfy.  Check. Lots of people on the buffet line.  Is there a buffet tonight?  No, they said, that's just for the private party.  Which turned out to be a BUSLOAD of Indian people.    No matter.  I looked at the menu, and ordered one of their combo dishes, along with a large Flying Horse.  Within minutes, complimentary papadum arrived, along with a tamarind sauce and a cilantro sauce.  To my surprise, the papadum were awesome.  Hot, crisp, tasty.  The sauces were excellent as well.  The combo arrived and the food continued to impress.  I haven't had Indian food this tasty and authentic since I was back in NY.  One thing I disliked was the dish - a metal plate with compartments which reminded me of a TV dinner.  I would have preferred to see several small plates, but I guess that would be more work.  The combo included a choice of dessert, and I passed up my usual kheer in favor of a pistachio kulfi ice cream recommended by my server.  It was AMAZING, except for the spoon (see below).  Reading the other reviews, either they have improved dramatically, or perhaps I was the beneficiary of stumbling on this place on a night where they knew they had to have their A game on (or risk upsetting said busload of people).  I would award 4 stars, except that my napkin was slightly dirty, and the spoon accompanying my dessert was clearly dirty as well (as in the dishwasher didn't do a good job).  I left stuffed and content, aka, feeling very un-Gandhi-like.

EVrfPsqJth0jogxVOE-vGg.text: Best Indian food I've ever had! Great environment, service was great, and the owner even helped us decide on what to order. I definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone. Very reasonably priced and clean. I was with my friend from California, she's been to many Indian restaurants,  and she loved this place.

JXek_-1Zylr2JKhxs15Kwg.text: After a long day of walking we decided to get some Indian food but was a huge let down. Located in a cheap strip mall, visit this place if you like to pay top dollars for bad quality food and below par customer service. The cheap plastic forks and spoons and the unfriendly behavior of the owner made our experience worse. This place is definitely not worth it's money.

LzNo9EaBTdpypWnyeCB54w.text: Food Quality is too bad. No service. No ventilation. This place used to be much better but now it's not worth.

hthyDc6wFJhmJT5f3jxPmQ.text: I ate at Gandhi last evening for about the 7th time and am finally writing a review ! This restaurant is delicious and is by far the most fantastic Indian restaurant in town.  Our server Crystal H. Was so attentive and knowledgable that she made a wonderful dining experience even better. I am vegetarian and my dining companion is allergic to nuts and there were several choices available to us ~ each one even more delicious than the next !!

w5go-tqZ-h24jxHKsbewlw.text: Best Indian cuisine I have ever been to! Exquisite dishes, reasonable prices, good service

HSvmYy7LFce1bI_fpLFmEQ.text: Awesome.  Great food & service. We'll be back very soon.  Tikka Masala is one of the best I've had.

gVEs8f3_DFbf9EMeJCOweg.text: The restaurant is very simple and plain on the outside.  Once you enter, the decor is simple, yet nice.  The atmosphere and music is upbeat.  Service was good and the food here is good, but nothing compared to Baluchi's in New York.  I was there with a group and we ordered mango lassi, a variety of naan, chicken vindaloo, chicken tikka masala, chicken biryani, and more...    The place is worth a try if you are out in Vegas and are willing to explore outside of the strip.

FgtOTjonvJwYEVIlQVbd2A.text: The food at Gandhi's was amazing!  The service was very hospitable.  I would recommend this to anyone who visits Vegas.  I definitely would come back whenever I visit.

b6lK8qLSG_XjeQ0UbPHglA.text: This restaurant was not one of the best.. It was way overpriced.. Food was mediocre.. The ambience was nice however. Would not recommend this. Try something else for Indian such as the Indian Masala Bistro.

RPTvwNreNmOsuiW4Lps7xA.text: Although the outside is not spectacular, I was impressed with their set up and buffet service. I was feeling the mood, the music, the food aroma, the curtains, etc. It was a nice place and our waiter was very attentive and funny. The food was delicious and I thoroughly enjoyed every dish. Mango Lassi was to die for. Overall, lunch buffet price is within inexpensive-affordable. I will be sure to make a trip here whenever I go to Vegas!!

pKA47kH_qWsuXKa21fTFpg.text: There is a lot of Indian Cuisine competition but this place does have great service and great comfort food at a good price. I really enjoy the neighborhood competition, Mint Indian Bistro and Origin of India more though, but there is something about this place that continues to keep itself standing, despite this. I would definitely go here if I had more friends who like Indian food or ate out as much as I used to. This place is a lot older. But I live right up the street from this place and if I got tired of frequenting Mint Indian Bistro on Flamingo, I would go here to get a change of setting. I think it is a little more authentic than the Mint, but I am not a fan of authentic, I like a little bit of flare to my food that is catered to Americans. My friend likes this place more than Mint, so maybe they have some special dishes that stand out for vegetarians...  Again, because it sits in a terrible neighborhood, the fact that it still survived the many years of recession probably says a lot about the authenticity of their dishes. I don't know a lot about their off the buffet menu entrees but I hear they are pretty good.  The decor has antique wood and has a fine dining appeal with the table cloth and nice water glass. But, this seems to be  a common theme for all of the Indian Restaurants, they are very properly set.  The Indian food buffet is a good deal, but if I had patience I would order off the menu because they will cook it to order and the food will taste fresh and more flavorful.

1ARG8718MrdktsIQbTb9hg.text: This was the best indian restaurant my parents liked. They r vegeterrian and were happy to see lot of veggi options ... Their food is like home and desserts (sevayian kheer) was awesome. I absolutely recommend brunch buffet. Good north-indian lunch and south indian breakfast. Overall a good place to have a brunch. +1 for Gandhi

Z3Oam1W-hidKWQftbJAkYA.text: Everything about this place was just so-so including the service.   Nothing was really bad but nothing stands out.  Had decent lamb vindaloo (asked for extra spicy but not so spicy), chickent tikka masala, malai kofta and a couple different naans- which weren't that great.    Still looking for a good cheap-eats Indian in Vegas.  This place is a little pricey though not as ridiculously overpriced as Gaylords.  If your craving decent Indian food and not afraid to spend a couple bucks then this place should fit the bill.

KcTTdt9toQGa8RlLVocKKQ.text: Not a good service experience after the third time. They give preference to people who arrive after you and i would not reccomend going there. Terrible experience from the OWNER.

KMifbKwTaBFwwyaJ_cZZ0g.text: I went for dinner and ordered the Tandoori chicken, it was very tender and flavorful. The atmosphere is also great. I am on atkins diet lately and I highly recommend their tandoori chicken (one order is more than enough for even two people)

w17oDruIn4XCrNe49Y7yxg.text: Desperate for some Indian food, we were referred to Gandhi's India's Cuisine.  We arrived at 3:30 pm, only to discover they don't open for dinner on a Saturday until 5 pm.  As we debated whether it was worth waiting for, a couple of guys pulled up next to us and RAVED about place...saying "It's REALLY good...It's HELLA good..."  So, hearing this, we had to come back at 5 pm and so we did...what a mistake!  As we piled in at 5:30 pm, we looked around at the customers already seated. Lots of Indians were already dining and we took this as a good sign...and then we saw the buffet table set up.  Hmmm...we were hoping for an a la carte menu.  Unfortunately, they only had the buffet option available and so we were stuck with that.    We ordered Mango Lassi to drink and that was a highlight.  Then we all loaded up for the buffet line.  Gandhi's offers a mix of North and South Indian cuisines and I was disappointed with pretty much everything available.  I usually want Indian food when I desire lots of rich spices and tastes going on, and all th dishes simmering away lacked any full or individual flavors.  There was no spice, no heat, nothing that stood out! Blah!    They offered mint-cilantro sauce, but no pappadoms!  Argh.  I love pappadoms and they didn't have any!  I was already disappointed!  I love naan bread in general, but usually try the garlic or onion kinds, or whatever else is offered.  Not at this place, they just had plain naan bread that lacked any real flavor.  Everything had potatoes in it, too much potatoes if any.  One of my dining companions felt that she didn't eat her money's worth and went back for dessert - the mango/condensed milk dessert with fruit cocktail.  We all agreed that was the only thing worth eating there.  How sad is that?!  Sure...I ate...I was hungry.  It wasn't particularly good Indian food.  It was just that...food, and nothing else.  This restaurant was noted as award winning and "Best Ethnic Restaurant in Las Vegas" at one point.  I would assume they were a pretty decent Indian restaurant some time ago, but no longer.  I guess it's a sign when an Indian restaurant starts out with an a la carte menu, then ditches it completely to go for the buffet thing, it means hard times.  They are strapped and desperate for business.  Too bad I won't be that desperate enough to come here again unless I'm dragged.  Yeah, for the price of less than $17/pp, you get more bang for your buck this way, but that's not why I came to Gandhi's to eat.

RHF2kcrJt5OUuqHBBCq1Dg.text: Despite being located in a seedy strip mall, a friend and I had previously tried this place for dinner, and it was decent, 3-star territory. However a recent visit to try their lunch buffet was a different story. The first thing that stuck out was the cheap plastic plates, disposable plastic eating utensils, and styrofoam/plastic cups for water and soups/sauces. I have been to many Indian lunch buffets, but this was the first time I've seen such cheap dining ware being used. While they had several vegetarian offerings, they only had a couple of mediocre meat dishes: chicken tikka masala and tandoori chicken. There was a huge tray of naan which looked overly doughy and dried out so I didn't even bother trying it. The subpar mango pudding was too watery and contained cheap canned fruit. The halwa dessert was extremely dry and just gross. My friend and I commented that the only thing at the buffet that they seemed to do pretty well was the basmati rice.  When the bill came, I was in for another shock. $12.95 for an Indian lunch buffet?!? That has got to make this the priciest one in town since most are in the range of $9.99 to $10.99. Now if this buffet was one of the best, I probably wouldn't mind paying a premium price. Come to think of it, if they lowered the price to $8.95, it still wouldn't be worth it. There are just too many better places in town, i.e. Taj Palace or Mt Everest., to waste your appetite on this one.

MlME5amJBYthnJrQfYH8Eg.text: Gandhi features a very solid Indian lunch buffet that can sometimes miss the mark slightly depending on the particular variety they put out for the day and how well it matches your personal preferences.  The location isn't the greatest, inside a rather nasty East Flamingo strip mall next to a cigar shop, but they do a good job of making you forget this once you enter the establishment.

iFlbMKL3qvafe5QTVR_tqw.text: I was on a vacation with my girl friend was craving for Indian food. Finally on the busy strip,I found Gandhi. Though I'm an Indian, its been long I had Indian food.    We were there for the buffet.The place was packed. There were lots variety of foods and  is one of the best buffets.Plenty of options for non-vegetarians and even for vegetarians like me.Navratna korma was awesome.  Crew was friendly and were prompt in serving.They made us feel like at home which justifies the crowd inside.It is definitely a good Indian restaurant.

YikiYQL6cHBDcy5Ov4O2_w.text: From a shady looking, wrecked place from outside to a exquisite Ethnic Indian Loungish looking interiors this restaurant really did surprise me. We infact planned to turn around go elsewhere looking at it from outside, and we are glad not to have done that. The restaurant has a lotta potential to be turned into an Indian Nightclub/Lounge at night, thanks to their multiple rooms, multiple floors, Red interior decor and tall ceilings. We took the Lunch Buffet which I felt was kinda OK. The best part of all was the Tandoori Chicken. Delishhh...one of the best I've tried. The rest were passable. Their Mango Lassi was pretty good however. Overall I felt $12 aint a bad deal for a quick Indian Lunch quite close to the strip in a grand setting.

yjKJi15VS3kxhYUVr2m4dA.text: IMHO the best indian food in Vegas.  One of my personal favorites is the prawn korma.  They have a good selection of naan and it's always fresh. A kingfisher beer makes a nice addition to a wonderful meal.  There is a lunch buffet too so you can try a little of everything.  Check it out  !
